**The Six Months of Abstinence (六斋月):**
  The **first**, **third**, **fifth**, **seventh**, **ninth**, and **eleventh** months.
  The **Three Celestial Orders** (三官) and the **Celestial Sovereign** (天帝) of the **Upper Three Heavens** (上三天) oversee and inspect the sins of mortals throughout the year. The **Celestial Sovereign** (天帝) of the **Upper Three Heavens** (上三天) presides over this judgment. If one practices the **Six Monthly Abstinence Rituals** (岁中六斋之法) faithfully, they may be freed from the **Ten Sufferings and Eight Hardships** (十苦八难), avoid calamity and punishment (免厄伐), and be granted an audience with the **Supreme One** (太上), allowing the **Three Corpses** (三尸) to depart and achieve **immortality** (长生不老).

**The Heavenly Master’s Teaching on the Rituals for Officials and Laypeople (天师教诸男女官为道):**
  During the **Six Months of Abstinence** (斋月), the **Ten Pure Months** (十直月) begin on the **first day**, the **Eight Days of the Northern Dipper** (北斗下八日) follow, then the **Ten Days of the Northern Dipper’s Officer of Life and Death** (北斗司命杀鬼下十四日), the **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity’s Messenger** (太一使者下十五日), the **Eighteen Days of the Celestial Sovereign** (天帝下十八日), the **Twenty-Three Days of the Uppermost Heaven** (天一下二十三日), the **Twenty-Four Days of the Eight Deities of Heavenly Unity** (太一八神使者下二十四日), the **Twenty-Eight Days of the Northern Pole** (北辰下二十八日), the **Twenty-Nine Days of the Uppermost Heaven** (下太一下二十九日), and the **Thirty Days of the Central Heaven** (中太一下月三十日). The **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity** (上太一自下十五日) conclude the cycle.

  On the **Eighteen Days of the Celestial Sovereign** (天帝下者), the **day, moon, stars, and constellations** (日月星宿) are within its purview, and all officials (诸官) descend together for the **thirty days**.

  On the **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity** (上太一自下者), the **day, moon, Five Stars, Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Azure Gem and Jade Balance** (璇玑玉衡), the **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper** (七星北斗), the **Officers of Life and Death** (司命司录), the **Officers of Punishment and Retribution** (司杀司罚), the **Great Saints and Venerable Deities** (大圣尊神), the **Mystic Conduct True Persons** (妙行真人), and the **Celestial Sovereign’s True King** (天帝真王) are within its purview, and all **heavens and spirits** (诸天及鬼神), officials (仙官) descend together for the **thirty days**.

  On these days, **celestial spirits and earthly deities** (天神地祇) alike tremble and circulate throughout the world, observing human **virtue and vice** (善恶). If one steadfastly cultivates with sincere devotion (执心精进), does not violate **scripture and teaching** (经教), expounds the **Dao/Way’s Law** (道法), prolongs life and augments destiny (益人寿算), and records the **virtuous and sinful deeds of mortals and spirits** (度录左契), they may be exempted from calamities (文免患难). Such individuals are known as **"Upper Three Heavens"** (上三天), **"Overcoming the Calamities"** (克名玉录), and are **elevated as True Persons** (拜为真人).

**The Eight Festival Days of the Daoist Assembly (八节日仙官会):**
  Their distinctions were previously mentioned.
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Spring** (立春日), the **True Person of the Supreme Ultimate** (太极真人) assembles all **Daoist True Persons** (诸仙真), carving **jade tablets** (刻玉简) and recording their names (记仙名).
  - On the **Day of the Spring Equinox** (春分日), the **True Person of Supreme Purity** (太素真人) assembles all **Daoist officials** (仙官), at the **Jade Terrace of Kunlun** (昆仑瑶台) to verify and rectify the **true scriptures** (真经).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Summer** (立夏日), the **Five Emperors** (五帝) convene with all **gods and Daoists** (神仙) at the **Purple Micro Palace** (紫微宫), where they meet the **Four True Persons** (见四真人) and judge the **merits and sins of those seeking the Dao** (论求道者之功罪).
  - On the **Day of the Summer Solstice** (夏至之日), the **Three Celestial Orders** (上三天官) gather at the **Lord of the Si He** (司何侯), to verify the **fate and fortune of ten thousand people** (校定万人罪福), extending years and reducing misfortunes (增年减算).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Autumn** (立秋之日), the **True Persons of the Five Sacred Peaks** (五岳真人) assemble to pay homage to the **Yellow Old Lord** (黄老君) at the **Yellow Chamber Cloud Court Mountain** (黄房云庭之山), gathering **Daoist officials** (仙官) to establish the **divine diagram and immortal elixirs** (定神图灵药).
  - On the **Day of the Autumn Equinox** (秋分之日), the **Uppermost Celestial Sovereign** (上皇太帝君) ascends to the **Supreme Purity** (上清), summoning **myriad True Persons and Daoists** (众真万仙) to convene at the **Lofty Yang Hall** (寥阳之殿). They collectively determine the **fate and fortune of ten thousand people** (议定天下万人罪福), record the **diligent or negligent pursuit of the Dao** (记学道求仙之懃懈), and clarify the **offenses against the day and moon** (疏犯过日月) and the **punishments for virtuous and sinful deeds** (修行善恶刑罚之科). The **roots and origins of rituals** (根源修例) are established, and the records are entrusted to the **Officer of Life** (副之司命), inscribed on the **Yellow Talisman** (书于黄箓).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Winter** (立冬之日), the **True Person of the Yang Terrace** (阳台真人) assembles all **Daoist immortals** (仙人), to verify and enroll those newly **enlightened to the Dao** (新得道), marking their entry into the **Daoist register** (始入名仙录).
  - On the **Day of the Winter Solstice** (冬至之日), all **Daoists** (仙) pay homage to the **Eastern Sea Green Boy Lord** (方诸东海青童君), to carve and define the **Daoist register** (刻定众仙籍). The **golden script** (金书) is inscribed with the **inner characters** (内字), aligned with the **stem and branch of the Geng-Shen day** (甲子日支干端数), and the **six decades** (六旬归宗) are harmonized with the **celestial and human records** (天人合纪). The **four seasons** (四时) are celebrated in joy (加庆).

  - On the **Day of the Geng-Shen Cycle** (庚申之日), **Golden Menace** (金威) brings stern punishment, the **Tai Fu Palace** (岱府) upholds the law, and the **soul and spirit** (魄精) are bound by transgressions. The **corpses and ghosts** (尸鬼) report evil deeds, and life originates from this source. Thus, one must **restrain the evil currents** (检遏邪津) and **manifest the true Dao** (开显正道).

**The Days of Celestial Movements (月建之日):**
  When the **yin and yang** (阴阳) shift their degrees, all **hundred spirits** (百神) receive their duties. The **new virtue** (建德惟新) begins, and all prior **condemnations** (先谴) are lifted. One may then **advance in virtuous cultivation** (进修后善).

**The Day of the New Moon (月晦之日):**
  The **yin essence is ruined** (阴精毁损), and the **lunar phases cycle** (躔次数周). The **Netherworld** (幽府) searches the records, and the **officials** (司官) establish the **laws** (定律).

**The Day of the Full Moon (月望之日):**
  The **full orb is complete** (圆魄充满), and the **sunlight harmonizes** (阳光合映), illuminating the **dark transgressions** (冥愆) and dispelling the **hidden sins** (幽咎). It scrutinizes the past and illuminates the future (察往照来), and its **mechanism** (机动) ensures **all is connected** (必接).

**The Day of the Geng-Shen Cycle (甲寅日):**
  It is also the **hour when souls and spirits grow restless** (魂魄躁竞之辰).

**The Ten Pure Months (十直之日):**
  All **celestial sovereigns and Daoist True Persons** (诸天上帝, 妙行真人) gather at the **Mysterious Capital Jade Palace** (玄都玉京), to pay homage to the **Emperor of the Great Dao** (虚皇大道君). They **verify and inspect the records of mortal and ghostly sins and merits** (简校人鬼生死罪录), distinguishing **virtue and vice** (善恶殊分).

**The Five Substances (五物):**
  Also called the **Five Phases** (五行):
  1. **Blood** (血) – **Heavenly Water** (天水),
  2. **Bone** (骨) – **Heavenly Wood** (天木),
  3. **Muscle/Flesh** (肉) – **Heavenly Earth** (天土),
  4. **Teeth** (齿) – **Heavenly Metal** (天金),
  5. **Breath** (气) – **Heavenly *Qi*** (天气).*」

**The Five Sacred Fires (天火) – Five Oaths (五盟):**
  These are the **Five Teachings** (五教), where those who do not sincerely uphold their bonds are bound by oath.

**The Seven Curses (七诅):**
  Those who violate **benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and trust** (仁义礼智信), invoking the **Dao/Way of Heavenly Gods, Earthly Spirits, Human Ghosts, Sun, Moon, Stars, and Blood Oaths** (道天神地祇人鬼日月星血盟).

**The Three Lifespans (三寿):**
  1. **Upper Grade (上品):** 120 years,
  2. **Middle Grade (中品):** 100 years,
  3. **Lower Grade (下品):** 80 years.

**The Three Fates (三命):**
  1. **Fated Punishment (罚命):** Lost by unvirtuous deeds (行不善天所亡).
     Those who **defy Heaven and Earth, scorn the sacred, ravage mountains and rivers, or harm the virtuous** (慢易天地，轻侮神灵，伐於山川，伤残贤良) are doomed by the **Celestial Storehouse** (天府所亡).
  2. **Fated Sickness (疾命):** Illness born of licentious desires (邪欲多病所生).
     Those who **indulge excessively in food and drink, or lack restraint in private matters** (饮食无量，房内无度) are struck by **malevolent forces** (众邪所疾), thwarting Heaven’s decree (天数不遂).
  3. **Fated Termination (度命):** The natural end of all fated lives (众命之数，纪物之终).
     **Mortals draw essence from the Divine** (人禀於神), **the Divine lingers in the vital essence** (神留於精), and when the essence is spent, **aging and death follow** (精尽老朽殂落).

**The Six Entrances (六入):**
  **Sounds enter the ears**, **colors the eyes**, **fragrances the nose**, **objects the body**, **flavors the tongue**, **matters the heart**.
  *(External stimuli are called "入".)*

**The Six Senses (六情):**
  *(As previously distinguished.)*
  1. **Ears** discern the **Five Tones** (宫商角征羽),
  2. **Eyes** perceive the **Five Colors** (青黄赤白黑),
  3. **Nose** detects **aromas and foul odors** (躁燋香臭腥腐),
  4. **Body** senses **temperature and texture** (寒温刚柔滑),
  5. **Tongue** tastes the **Five Flavors** (酸苦甘辛醎),
  6. **Heart** discerns **virtue, vice, joy, anger, sorrow, and delight** (善恶喜怒哀乐).
  *(External stimuli are called "dust" (尘), internal responses "emotions" (情).)*

**The Six Virtues (六度):**
  1. **Diligence in advancement** (能进勤),
  2. **Humility in retreat** (能守雌),
  3. **Completing what is begun** (能施终),
  4. **Enduring insults** (能忍辱),
  5. **Upholding trust** (能戒信),
  6. **Abandoning wine and lust** (能弃酒色).

**The Eight Practices (八行):**
  1. **Accepting blame without self-justification** (能受非不自申),
  2. **Yielding virtue to others** (能让德於人),
  3. **Refraining from coveting others’ desires** (能不欲人之欲),
  4. **Tolerating injustice without complaint** (能容无理不诉),
  5. **Avoiding distant travels, hiding in seclusion** (能无远道身藏幽处),
  6. **Never betraying one’s true heart** (能不自违心),
  7. **Never violating scriptural precepts** (能不负经戒),
  8. **Never reciting scriptures for personal gain** (能不代口所诵).

**The Four Virtues (四德):**
  1. **Resolute intent** (志向定矣),
  2. **Unshakable principle** (秉操坚矣),
  3. **Unflagging devotion** (勤心至矣),
  4. **Steadfast restraint** (守情笃矣).

**The Five Torments (五毒):**
  1. **Drowning in water** (水漂溺之苦),
  2. **Burning in fire** (火焚灼之苦),
  3. **Assault by bandits and weapons** (五贼五兵之苦),
  4. **Madness and violent illness** (病狂厉之苦),
  5. **Harm from venomous creatures** (害玃搏齿蹋触螫之毒).

**The Nine Palaces (九府):**
  **Celestial Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (天官中府左府右府),
  **Earthly Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (地府#1中府左府右府),
  **Water Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (水官中府左府中府).

**The Three Treasures (三宝):**
  Also called the **Three Revered Ones** (三尊):
  **Dao/Way Treasure** (道宝), **Scripture Treasure** (经宝), **True Person Treasure** (真人宝).

**The Three Sacred Scriptures (三奇):**
  1. *The Great Cavern True Scripture* (《大洞真经》),
  2. *The Feminine Unity Five Elders Scripture* (《雌一五老经》),
  3. *The Hidden Elixir of the Great Dan Scripture* (《太丹隐书经》).

**The Nine Celestial Palaces (仙府九宫):**
  1. **Great Clarity** (太清),
  2. **Great Polarity** (太极),
  3. **Great Obscurity** (太微),
  4. **Purple Chamber** (紫房),
  5. **Mysterious Platform** (玄台),
  6. **Imperial Hall** (帝堂),
  7. **Heavenly Storehouse** (天府),
  8. **Royal Palace** (皇宫),
  9. **Jade Capital Mysterious Metropolis** (玉京玄都).

**The Nine Grades of Divine Elixirs (神丹九品):**
  1. **Supreme Harmony Natural Dragon Womb Nectar** (太和自然龙胎之醴),
  2. **Jade Womb Essence Ointment** (玉胎琼液之膏),
  3. **Flying Elixir Purple Flower Refined Essence** (飞丹紫华流精),
  4. **Pearl-Light Snowy Jade Nourishment** (珠光雪碧之腴),
  5. **Nine Springs Red Flower Divine Elixir** (九泉红华神丹),
  6. **Supreme Clarity Golden Elixir** (太清金液之华),
  7. **Nine Refined Frost-Snow Elixir** (九转霜雪之丹),
  8. **Nine Cauldrons Cloud Essence** (九鼎云英),
  9. **Cloud-Light Water-Stone Flowing Constellation** (云光水石流霞).

**The Three Upper Heavens (上三天):**
  **Great Vermilion Heaven** (太赤天), **Yu’s Remnant Heaven** (禹余天), **Pure Luminosity Heaven** (清微天).

**The Six Celestial Realms Below (故治六天下上):**
  1. **Vermilion Void Heaven** (第一赤虚天),
  2. **Great Mysterious Capital** (第二泰玄都),
  3. **Luminous Heaven** (第三皓天),
  4. **Great Mysterious Heaven** (第四泰玄天),
  5. **Supreme Mysterious Azure Heaven** (第五太玄苍天),
  6. **Supreme Clarity Heaven** (第六太清天).

**The Nine Heavens of Primordial Beginning (元始九天):**
  1. **Idyllic Boundless Heaven** (郁单无量天), **24 million li** from the second.
  2. **Uppermost Upper Tranquil Blessed Boundless Lifespan Heaven** (上上禅善无量寿天), **4,600 million li** from the third.
  3. **Brahman’s Supervisory Extended Heaven** (梵监须延天), **672 million li** from the fourth.
  4. **Silent Encompassing Tu-Su Heaven** (寂然兜术天), **1,240 million li** from the fifth.
  5. **Unarrogant Joyful Heaven** (不骄乐天), **3,680 million li** from the sixth.
  6. **Responsive Sound Heaven** (化应声天), **5,384 million li** from the seventh.
  7. **Brahman’s Treasure Heaven** (梵宝天), **520 million li** from the eighth.
  8. **Brahman’s Maha-Kala Heaven** (梵摩迦夷天), **680 million li** from the ninth.
  9. **Bodhi’s Answering Heaven** (波梨答和天), **500 billion, 20 million li** below.

**The Eight Directions of the Mysterious Metropolis (玄都八方):**
  **East – Great Hall District:** Receives the Virtuous (纳善世).
  **South – Wanli City:** Abandons the Wise (弃贤世).
  **West – Blessing Hall Prefecture:** [Text missing] (□□□#2).
  **North – Idyllic Wilderness:** Pure World (清净世).
  **Southeast – No-Blessing Fields:** Uses the Wise (用贤世).
  **Southwest – Extended Blessing District:** Tranquil Benevolence (仁静世).
  **Northwest – Blessing Virtue District:** Extends the Wise (延贤世).
  **Northeast – Blessing Gathering District:** Long Peace (长安世).

**The Nine Soils of Kunlun (昆仑九土):**
  **East – Faith Soil, Yang Prefecture** (信土阳州),
  **South – Scattered Soil, Welcoming Prefecture** (泼土迎州),
  **West – Cleaved Soil, Gathering Prefecture** (坼土拾州),
  **North – Complete Soil, Mysterious Prefecture** (成土玄州),
  **Central – Facing Soil, Ji Prefecture** (中面土冀州),
  **Northeast – Salty Soil,威 Prefecture** (咸土威州),
  **Southeast – Agricultural Soil, Divine Prefecture** (农土神州),
  **Southwest – Sunken Soil, Achievement Prefecture** (陷土成州),
  **Northwest – Fertile Soil, Pillar Prefecture** (肥土柱州).

**The Nine Primordial Cycles of Heaven and Earth (天地九元):**
  **Upper Primordial (上元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 81 million years (九九八十一万岁),
    - **Middle:** 64 million years (八八六十四万岁),
    - **Lower:** 49 million years (七七四十九万岁).
  **Middle Primordial (中元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 36 million years (六六三十六万岁),
    - **Middle:** 25 million years (五五二十五万岁),
    - **Lower:** 16 million years (四四十六万岁).
  **Lower Primordial (下元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 9 million years (三三九万岁),
    - **Middle:** 4 million years (二二四万岁),
    - **Lower:** 2 million years (一一二万岁).
  **Total:** 286 million years (右三元合二百八十六万岁).

**At this time, the Celestial Sovereign resides in the Jade-Yu Heavenly Palace (贾奕天上, 七宝紫微宫中), teaching the **Mysterious Law** (妙法) to **700 billion beings** (七千亿众). Among them, a **True Person named Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard** (海空智藏) knelt in homage and inquired:
*"How do mortals who aspire to the Dao/Way attain enlightenment? What are the ranks and transformations—from the Three Pure Ones to the Ten Transmutations—and their respective titles?"* (玄门众生，发心入道，阶级升降，三清十转名号).

At that time, the Celestial Sovereign instructed **Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard** (海空智藏):

*"You must understand that the **Great Saints of the Ten Directions** (十方大圣) enter the Dao/Way through three progressive stages of ten transformations each, ascending in order. You must now carefully listen to the ten transformations, for they differ entirely from the three preceding stages.

What are these three stages? First, the **Stage of Faith** (信阶); second, the **Stage of Practice** (行阶); third, the **Stage of Dedication** (回向阶).

Within the **Stage of Faith** (信膈), there are ten states of mind. What are these ten? First, the **Mind of Faith** (信心); second, the **Mind of Advancement** (进心); third, the **Mind of Reflection** (念心); fourth, the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧心); fifth, the **Mind of Concentration** (定心); sixth, the **Mind of Precepts** (戒心); seventh, the **Mind of Dedication** (回向心); eighth, the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法心); ninth, the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法心); tenth, the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心).

Within the **Stage of Practice** (行阶), there are ten practices: the **Mind of Faith** (信), the **Mind of Advancement** (进), the **Mind of Reflection** (念), the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧), the **Mind of Concentration** (定), the **Mind of Precepts** (戒), the **Mind of Dedication** (回向), the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法), the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法), and the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心)—these are the ten practices.

Within the **Stage of Dedication** (回向阶), there are ten dedicatory practices: the **Mind of Faith** (信心), the **Mind of Advancement** (进心), the **Mind of Reflection** (念心), the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧心), the **Mind of Concentration** (定心), the **Mind of Precepts** (戒心), the **Mind of Dedication** (回向心), the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法心), the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法心), and the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心)—these are the ten dedicatory practices, comprising the three stages of aspiration.

The **method of entering the Dao/Way** (入道方便) relies on **victorious aspiration** (胜心) to proceed into the ten transformations, which are entirely distinct from the previous ten.

What are these ten? First, the **Transformation of True Realization** (证实转); second, the **Transformation of Removing Obstacles** (离障转); third, the **Transformation of Radiant Clarity and Counteraction** (光明对治转); fourth, the **Transformation of Wisdom-Fire Consuming** (智火烧然转); fifth, the **Transformation of Subduing Demons** (权魔胜转); sixth, the **Transformation of Manifesting Virtues** (现前显德转); seventh, the **Transformation of Illuminating the Distant Path** (远行光惠转); eighth, the **Transformation of Unchanging Non-Duality** (相无相不动转); ninth, the **Transformation of Concentration and Wisdom in Harmony** (定慧相应转); tenth, the **Transformation of Ultimate Dharma Realm** (法地究竟转).

**Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard**, these ten transformations are the same as those taught by the Celestial Sovereign in the **past, future, and present three worlds** (过去未来见在三世), though spoken at different times, to be praised and countered.

The **True Person** (道心真人) faces ten kinds of obstacles in their aspiration to the Dao/Way. What are these ten? First, the obstacle of **countering the defilements of beings** (对治众生障); second, the obstacle of **countering the evil deeds of beings** (对治众生邪行障); third, the obstacle of **not understanding or enduring the teachings upon hearing or reflection** (於闻思修习受忍不通障); fourth, the obstacle of **arrogance arising from self-liberation** (自六解发心起高慢障); fifth, the obstacle of **egoistic attachment to the nature of dharmas** (我慢众人障); sixth, the obstacle of **habitual defilements from prior transformations** (除十转己前烦恼习障); seventh, the obstacle of **subtle defilements of wisdom** (除细法智障); eighth, the obstacle of **remaining deluded despite severing ignorance** (断无明有障); ninth, the obstacle of **not abandoning unwholesome deeds** (断不善利佗障); tenth, the obstacle of **not attaining freedom in the Dharma** (於法示得自在障).

**Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard True Person**, to sever these ten obstacles of entering the Dao/Way, practices and extinguishes them utterly, so that they do not arise again. Thus, the ten transformations are established.

Why? The reason for naming these transformations from **True Realization** (证实) to **Ultimate Dharma Realm** (地究竟) is to benefit beings, gradually enlightening their wisdom and leading them into the transformations of the Dao/Way.

The meaning of the ten transformations is as follows:

The **First Transformation of True Realization** (证实转) is to **attain insight into the true and wondrous nature of the Dao/Way** (证见道性真实妙理).

The **Second Transformation of Removing Obstacles** (离障转) is to **obtain pure and wondrous precepts**, fully endowed with purity, **removing defilements and avarice**, hence the name.

The **Third Transformation of Radiant Clarity and Counteraction** (光明对治转) is to **reflect upon and practice flawless teachings**, **illuminating and manifesting** them clearly.

The **Fourth Transformation of Wisdom-Fire Consuming** (智火烧然转) is to **burn defilements to ashes with the fire of wisdom** (烦恼成薪，智火烧烬).

The **Fifth Transformation of Subduing Demons** (摧魔胜转) is to **acquire transcendent, flawless wisdom**, **virtuous means**, and **freedom from all defilements**, **abandoning the defiled mind**, and **subduing all demons** (降伏众魔).

The **Sixth Transformation of Manifesting Virtues** (现前显德转) is to **enter profound wisdom**, **reach the other shore**, and **benefit all beings** (自佗俱利), **manifesting the virtues of wisdom** (智德现前).

The **Seventh Transformation of Illuminating the Distant Path** (远行光慧转) is to **practice the Dharma of non-duality**, **culminating in its power**, **like a traveler gradually moving away from home** (去我渐远).

The **Eighth Transformation of Unchanging Non-Duality** (不动转) is to **refine the fruits of virtue**, **remaining undisturbed in the practice of non-duality** (於无相行中无间阙).

The **Ninth Transformation of Concentration and Wisdom in Harmony** (定慧相应转) is to **attain unobstructed wisdom**, **benefiting all beings in teaching the Dharma** (向众生说法成就中利佗).

The **Tenth Transformation of Ultimate Dharma Realm** (法地究竟转) is to **obtain the Dharma Body**, **perfect in all virtues**, and **ultimately free** (毕竟自在).

Thus, the **Great Bodhisattva** (大士) receives the **position of the Dharma King** (法王位), akin to a **prince attaining sovereignty among all kings** (太子於诸王中而得自在).

Even in this position of the ten transformations, **subtle obstacles remain**, as **liberation has not yet been fully attained**. To counter these **subtle, habitual obstacles** (微细障), one must not yet have **entered the Celestial Sovereign’s realm** (证入天尊地).

In this stage, **all practices are consummated**, **all virtues are perfected**, **the Dao/Way’s nature is fully realized**, and **wisdom and virtue are equal and undivided**. The **Five Aggregates and Three Powers** (五大三德) are complete, and the **ten virtues of the Dharma** (十法) are fully attained, **culminating in the Three Bodies and the Dharma Response** (三身法报应等), with **aspirations and virtues perfected**.

What are these **ten virtues of the Dharma** (十法具足)? First, **severing the parents of ignorance** (辞无明父母); second, **parting from the relatives of birth and death** (别生死眷属); third, **entering the profound Dao/Way** (入重玄门); fourth, **attending the Celestial Sovereign in the Ten Directions** (历事十方天尊); fifth, **recognizing their companions** (与其伴类相识); sixth, **sitting together on the bed of liberation** (同坐解脱床); seventh, **attaining ultimate and constant bliss** (究竟常乐); eighth, **gathering and receiving disciples** (摄受门徒); ninth, **granting the Three Vehicles of teaching** (授布三乘教法); tenth, **perfecting thirteen virtues** (十三德圆备).

What are these **three virtues** (三德)? First, the **virtue of realizing the Dao/Way** (证道智德); second, the **virtue of defilements** (烦恼德); third, the **virtue of compassion and boundless kindness** (悲多恩德).

With **wealth in sovereign freedom**, the **Three Bodies are fully realized**: the **Dharma Body** (法身), the **Reward Body** (报身), and the **Response Body** (应身).

The **scriptures of the Dao/Way’s gate** (道门经法) are transmitted in this sequence. *End of Volume #1.*

---
*Note: Corrected terms as per annotations:*
- **地府** → *"**地官**"* (Earthly Bureau of Officials)
- *Added missing "十" (ten) before "十三德" (virtues) for grammatical accuracy.*

chunks.original_text: 道门经法相承次序 经名：道门经法相承次序。 原不题撰人。 内载唐天皇（唐高宗）问道於中岳潘尊师（潘师正），当系唐代上清派道士编撰。 原本一卷，徒分作三卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》太平部。 道门经法相承次序卷上 原夫道家由肇，起自无先，垂迹应感，生乎妙一，从乎妙一，分为三元，又从三元，变成三气，又从三气，变生三才，三才既立，万物斯备。 其三元者，第一混洞太无元，第二赤混太无元，第三冥寂玄通元。 从混洞太无元化生天宝君，从赤混大无元化生灵宝君，从冥寂玄通元化生神宝君。 大洞迹别出为化主，治在三清境。 其三清境者，玉清、上清、太清是也，亦名三天。 其三天者，清微天、禹余天、大赤天是也。 天宝君治在玉清境，即清微天也，其气青始。 灵宝君治在上清境，即禹余天也，其气白元。 神宝君治在太清境，即大赤天也，其气黄玄。 故《九天生神章经》云：此三号年殊号异，本同一也，此三君各为教主，即是三洞之尊神也。 其三洞者，谓洞真、洞玄、洞神是也。 天宝君说十二部经，为洞真教主。 灵宝君说十二部经，为洞玄教主。 神宝君说十二部经，为洞神教主。 三洞合成三十六部尊经。 第一洞真为大乘，第二洞玄为中乘，第三洞神为小乘。 从三洞总成七部者：洞真、洞玄、洞神、太玄、太平、太清。 为辅经，太玄辅洞真，太平辅洞玄，太清辅洞神。 三辅合成三十六部，正一盟威通贯总成七部，故曰三洞尊文，七部玄教。 又从七部泛开三十六部。 其三十六部者：第一本文，第二神符，第三玉诀，第四灵图，第五谱录，第六诫律，第七威仪，第八方法，第九众述，第十传记，第十一赞诵，第十二表奏，三洞各有十二部，三洞合成三十六部。 其三气者，玄、元、始三炁是也。 始气青，在清微天； 元气白，在禹余天； 玄气黄，在大赤天。 故云玄元始三气也。 又从玄元始变生阴阳和，又从阴阳和变生天地人。 故《老经》云：道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。 自玄都玉京已下，合有三十六天，二十八天是三界内，八天是三界外。 其三界者：欲界、色界、无色界。 从下六天为欲界，次十八天为色界，次四天为无色界，三界合二十八天。 其三界胜境，身相端严。 从欲界天已上，人寿命长远，皆以黄金为地，白玉为阶，珠玉珍宝，自然而有，虽复雅乐，并不兔生死。 其次三界上四天，名为种人天，亦名圣弟子天，亦名四梵天，此人断生死，三灾之所不能及。 其次即至三境，境别左右中三宫，宫别有仙王、仙公、仙卿、仙伯、仙大夫，别有一太上，一老君天师。 太清境有九仙，上清境有九真，玉清境有九圣，三九二十七位也。 其九仙者：第一上仙，二高仙，三大仙，四玄仙，五天仙，六真仙，七神仙，八灵仙，九至仙。 真圣二境，其号次第，亦以上、高、大、玄、天、真、神、灵、至为次，但真云仙真、元真，真圣云仙圣、无天圣。 最上一天名曰大罗天，在玄都玉京山上。 紫微金阙，七宝骞树，麒磷师子，化生其中，三世天尊，治在其内。 欲界二十八天，其次四天，次三境，最上大罗，合三十六天。 总是天尊所统。 故经云：三界之上，渺渺大罗，上无色根，云层峨峨，唯有元始，浩劫之家。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Succession of Daoist Scriptures and Teachings**

**Title:** *The Succession of Daoist Scriptures and Teachings*
(Original unattributed author)
This text records Emperor Tang Tianhuang (Emperor Gaozong of Tang) seeking the Dao from Zhongyue Master Pan (Pan Shizheng), likely compiled by Tang-era Shangqing Daoists. The original single scroll was later divided into three volumes. The source text is from *The Canon of Orthodox Daoist Scripture (Zhengtong Daozang)*, the Taiping section.

---

**Volume One: The Origin and Succession of Daoist Teachings**

The Daoist lineage originates from the formless beginning, manifesting through response and sensation, emerging from the wondrous One. From the wondrous One, it divides into the Three Primordials (*sānyuán*), which further transform into the Three Qi (*sānqì*), and from the Three Qi arise the Three Realms (*sāncái*). Once the Three Realms are established, all things are complete.

The Three Primordials are:
1. **Hundun Taowu Yuan** (Mixed Void Primordial of the Great Non-Being),
2. **Chihun Taowu Yuan** (Red Mixed Primordial of the Great Non-Being),
3. **Mingji Xuantong Yuan** (Silent and Mysterious Communicating Primordial).

From **Hundun Taowu Yuan** emanates Tianbao Jun (Celestial Treasure Lord),
From **Chihun Taowu Yuan** emanates Lingbao Jun (Numinous Treasure Lord),
From **Mingji Xuantong Yuan** emanates Shenbao Jun (Divine Treasure Lord).

The Great Void Manifestation (*Dadong Jibie*) further distinguishes the **Hua Zhu** (Transformation Master), governing the Three Pure Realms.

The Three Pure Realms are:
- **Yuqing** (Jade Purity),
- **Shangqing** (Upper Purity),
- **Taqing** (Great Purity),
also called the Three Heavens.

The Three Heavens are:
- **Qingwei Tian** (Pure Mists Heaven),
- **Yuyu Tian** (Jade Remnant Heaven),
- **Dachi Tian** (Great Red Heaven).

Tianbao Jun governs the Yuqing Realm, which is Qingwei Tian, its qi being **Qingchi** (Azure Beginning).
Lingbao Jun governs the Shangqing Realm, which is Yuyu Tian, its qi being **Baiyuan** (White Primordial).
Shenbao Jun governs the Taqing Realm, which is Dachi Tian, its qi being **Huangxuan** (Yellow Mysterious).

Thus, the *Chapter on the Nine Heavens Generating Spirits* states:
*"These three names differ in years and titles, yet their essence is one. These three Lords are each the teaching masters of the Three Caverns, the exalted deities of the Three Caverns."*

The Three Caverns (*sāndòng*) are:
- **Dongzhen** (Cavern of Perfected Truth),
- **Dongxuan** (Cavern of Mysterious Primordials),
- **Dongshen** (Cavern of Divine Manifestations).

Tianbao Jun expounds the **Twelve Departments of Scripture**, becoming the master of the Dongzhen Cavern.
Lingbao Jun expounds the **Twelve Departments of Scripture**, becoming the master of the Dongxuan Cavern.
Shenbao Jun expounds the **Twelve Departments of Scripture**, becoming the master of the Dongshen Cavern.

The Three Caverns together form **Thirty-Six Exalted Scriptures**. The first, Dongzhen, is the **Great Vehicle**; the second, Dongxuan, is the **Middle Vehicle**; the third, Dongshen, is the **Lesser Vehicle**.

From the Three Caverns, seven departments are synthesized:
- **Dongzhen, Dongxuan, Dongshen** (the three caverns),
- **Taixuan** (Great Mysterious),
- **Taiping** (Great Peace),
- **Taqing** (Great Purity),
as auxiliary scriptures. **Taixuan** aids Dongzhen, **Taiping** aids Dongxuan, and **Taqing** aids Dongshen.

The three auxiliaries combine to form the **Thirty-Six Departments**, while the **Seven Departments of Unified Command** (*Zhengyi Mengwei Tongguan*) synthesize into seven, hence the saying: *"Three Caverns of Exalted Texts, Seven Departments of Mysterious Teachings."*

From these seven, the **Thirty-Six Departments** further expand. The Thirty-Six Departments are:
1. **Benwen** (Original Texts),
2. **Shenfu** (Divine Talismans),
3. **Yujue** (Jade Secrets),
4. **Lingtu** (Numinous Diagrams),
5. **Pulu** (Genealogies and Records),
6. **Jielü** (Precepts and Statutes),
7. **Weiyi** (Ceremonial Etiquette),
8. **Fangfa** (Methods and Techniques),
9. **Chongshu** (Assemblies and Discourses),
10. **Chuanji** (Transmissions and Biographies),
11. **Zansong** (Hymns and Chants),
12. **Biaoshou** (Tables and Petitions).
Each of the Three Caverns contains twelve departments, totaling **Thirty-Six Departments**.

The Three Qi are:
- **Xuanqi** (Mysterious Qi),
- **Yuanqi** (Primordial Qi),
- **Shiqì** (Beginning Qi).

**Shiqì** is azure, located in Qingwei Tian;
**Yuanqi** is white, located in Yuyu Tian;
**Xuanqi** is yellow, located in Dachi Tian.
Thus, they are called the **Three Qi of Xuan, Yuan, and Shi**.

From these three qi, **Yin, Yang, and Harmony** arise, which further generate **Heaven, Earth, and Humanity**.

Thus, the *Laozi Jing* states:
*"The Dao gives birth to One, One gives birth to Two, Two gives birth to Three, Three gives birth to all things."*

From **Xuandu Yujing** downward, there are **Thirty-Six Heavens** in total. Of these, **Twenty-Eight Heavens** are within the Three Realms, and **Eight Heavens** are beyond them.

The Three Realms are:
- **Yùjiè** (Realm of Desire),
- **Sèjiè** (Realm of Form),
- **Wúsèjiè** (Realm of Formlessness).

The lower **Six Heavens** belong to the Realm of Desire,
The next **Eighteen Heavens** belong to the Realm of Form,
The upper **Four Heavens** belong to the Realm of Formlessness,
totaling **Twenty-Eight Heavens** within the Three Realms.

The Three Realms’ exalted domains possess refined and solemn forms. From the **Realm of Desire** upward, human lifespans extend greatly, their lands made of gold, their steps of white jade, and treasures of pearls and jewels appearing naturally. Though refined music resounds, they are free from birth and death.

The next **Four Heavens** above the Three Realms are called **Zhongrén Tian** (Heavens of Nurturing Humans), also **Sheng Dizi Tian** (Heavens of Holy Disciples), or **Sifan Tian** (Four Brahman Heavens). Those who reach here transcend birth and death, beyond the reach of the Three Calamities.

Above these are the **Three Realms**, divided into left, right, and central palaces, each containing:
- **Xianwang** (Immortal Kings),
- **Xian Gong** (Immortal Dukes),
- **Xian Qing** (Immortal Viscounts),
- **Xian Bo** (Immortal Marquises),
- **Xian Dafu** (Immortal High Officers),
alongside **one Taishang Laojun** (Supreme Venerable Lord) and **one Tian Shi** (Celestial Master).

The **Taqing Realm** has **Nine Xian** (Immortals):
1. Shangxian (Highest Immortal),
2. Gaoxian (Lofty Immortal),
3. Daxian (Great Immortal),
4. Xuánxian (Mysterious Immortal),
5. Tianxian (Celestial Immortal),
6. Zhenxian (True Immortal),
7. Shenxian (Divine Immortal),
8. Lingxian (Spiritual Immortal),
9. Zhixian (Ultimate Immortal).

The **Zhen-Sheng** (True-Sage) Realms follow a similar numbering sequence—**Shang, Gao, Da, Xuan, Tian, Zhen, Shen, Ling, Zhi**—but with variations:
- For **Zhen** (True): *Xianzhen* (Immortal True), *Yuanzhen* (Primordial True),
- For **Sheng** (Sage): *Xiansheng* (Immortal Sage), *Wutian Sheng* (Sage Beyond Heaven).

The highest heaven is named **Daluo Tian** (Great Luo Heaven), located atop **Xuandu Yujing Mountain**. There, the **Ziwu Jinque** (Purple Micro Star Gate) stands, adorned with **seven-treasure cypress trees**, where **qilin** and **shishi** (mythical beasts) roam. The **Three-World Venerable Sovereigns** govern within.

The **Twenty-Eight Heavens of Desire**, the **Four Heavens above**, the **Three Realms**, and the **Daluo Heaven** above them—all **Thirty-Six Heavens**—are under the dominion of the Celestial Sovereigns.

Thus, the scripture declares:
*"Above the Three Realms lies the boundless Daluo Heaven,
Without form or root, its clouds towering and vast—
Only Yuan Shi remains,
The eternal home of the Great Cataclysm."*

chunks.original_text: 三代天尊者：过去元始天尊，现在太上玉皇天尊，未来金阙玉晨天尊。 然太上即是元始天尊弟子。 从上皇半劫已来，元始天尊禅位。 三代天尊：亦有十号：第一自然，二元极，三大道，四至真，五太上，六道君，七高皇，八天尊，九玉帝，十陛下。 寻道家经诰，起自三元，从本降迹，成於五德，以三就五，乃成八会。 其八会之字，妙气所成，八角垂芒，凝空云篆，太真按笔，玉妃拂筵，黄金为书，白玉为简，秘於诸天之上，藏於七宝玄台，有道即现，无道即隐。 盖是自然天书，非关苍颉所作。 今传《灵宝经》者，则是天真皇人，於峨媚山受於轩辕黄帝。 又天真皇人受帝誉於牧德之台。 夏禹感降於锺山，阖闾窃窥於句曲。 其后有葛孝先之类，郑思远之徒，师资相承，缠联不绝。 其老子《道德经》，乃是大乘部摄正，当三辅之经，未入三洞之教。 今人学多浮浅，唯诵道德，不识真经，即谓道教起自庄周，殊不知始乎柱下也。 眷言弱丧，深可哀哉！ 蠡酌管窥，一至於此，何者？

The **Three Celestial Sovereigns of the Dao** are: the **Past Yuan Shi Tianzun** (Celestial Sovereign of the Primordial Beginning), the **Present Taishang Yuhuang Tianzun** (Celestial Sovereign of the Supreme Jade Emperor), and the **Future Jinque Yuchen Tianzun** (Celestial Sovereign of the Golden Gate and Jade Dawn).

Yet, the **Taishang** (Supreme Emperor) is himself a disciple of the **Yuan Shi Tianzun**. Since the **Shang Huang** (Upper Emperor) took his seat half a *kāli* (eon) ago, the **Yuan Shi Tianzun** has been in meditation.

The **Three Celestial Sovereigns** also possess ten titles:
1. **Ziran** (Natural),
2. **Yuanji** (Primordial Extremity),
3. **Dadao** (Great Dao),
4. **Zhizhen** (Ultimate Truth),
5. **Taishang** (Supreme),
6. **Daojun** (Dao Lord),
7. **Gaohuang** (High Emperor),
8. **Tianzun** (Celestial Sovereign),
9. **Yudi** (Jade Emperor),
10. **Bixia** (Your Majesty).

Examining the Daoist scriptures and canons, they originate from the **Three Primordial** (Three Yuan), descend from the **Five Phases** (Five De), and culminate in the **Eight Trigrams** (Eight Xie). By uniting the **Three** with the **Five**, they form the **Eight Assemblies** (Eight Hui).

The characters of the **Eight Assemblies** are formed by **Miaoji** (subtle *qi*), with eight angles and drooping rays, condensed in the void as celestial cloud inscriptions. **Tai Zhen** (Supreme Truth) holds the brush, **Yu Fei** (Jade Consort) sweeps the mat, **Huang Jin** (Yellow Gold) serves as the book, and **Bai Yu** (White Jade) as the pages. They are sealed in the heavens above and stored in the **Seven-Treasure Mysterious Platform** (Qiantai). When the Dao is present, they appear; when the Dao is absent, they vanish.

This is the **Natural Heavenly Scripture**, not the work of **Cang Jie** (the legendary inventor of Chinese writing). The transmitted *Lingbao Jing* (Scripture of the Sacred Treasure) is authored by **Tian Zhen Huangren** (the Heavenly True Yellow Man), received at **Emei Mountain** from **Xuanyuan Huangdi** (the Yellow Emperor of the Five Augusts).

Moreover, the **Tian Zhen Huangren** received imperial decrees at the **Mudu Platform** (De’s Pavilion). **Xia Yu** (Emperor Yu of the Xia) was inspired by its descent at **Zhong Mountain**, and **He Lu** (King Goujian of Yue) secretly glimpsed it at **Jouqu River**.

Later, there were disciples like **Ge Xiaoxian** and **Zheng Siyuan**, passing down the teachings in an unbroken lineage. As for **Laozi’s** *Daode Jing* (Classic of the Dao and Virtue), it is categorized under the **Great Vehicle Section** (Dacheng) of the **Orthodox Daoist Canon** (Zhengzong), ranking as a **Three Auxiliary Scripture** (San Fu), yet not entering the **Three Caverns Teachings** (San Dong).

Today, people’s learning is often shallow—they recite only the *Daode Jing*, unaware of the **True Scripture**, and mistakenly claim Daoism began with **Zhuang Zhou** (Master Zhuang), not knowing its origins trace back to **Zhuxia** (the Sage of the Pillar). Alas, how lamentable!

With such limited understanding—like sipping from a ladle or peering through a tube—how can one grasp the full extent of this? What is the true measure of attainment?

chunks.original_text: 老君生於殷末，长自周初，托神玄妙玉女，处胎八十一载，逍遥李树之下，剖左腋而生，生即皓然，号曰老子，指树为氏，因姓李焉。 其相也，美眉黄色，日角月悬，蹈五把十，耳有三门，鼻有双柱。 周德既衰，世道交丧，平王三十三年十二月二十五日，去周而度青牛薄辇，紫气浮关，遂付道德真经於关令尹喜。 由此明道家经诰，非唯五千。 元始天尊，宝珠老子，岂唯年代差异，亦自位号不同。 若为名三界，一者，欲界有六天，即从《度人经》太黄皇曾天数满六天。 是欲界人，寿命万岁，人在世生不犯身业杀盗之罪，来生即登此天，此天之中无六欲染着，故生此天。 二者，色界有十八天，即以次取之其中，人寿亿万岁。 若人一生之中，不犯心业贪嗔之罪，得生此天。 三者，无色界四天，其中人寿命亿劫岁。 若人一生之中，不恶口两舌，妄言绮语，当来过往，得居此天。 其中善男子善女人，功行满足，堪上四天者，王母迎之，登上四天。 其三界无上常融天，太释腾胜天，龙变梵度天，太极贾奕天，此四天名四种人天，即三界之上，灾所不及。 四人天上有三清境：第一太清，第二上清，第三玉清。 三清之上，即是大罗天，元始天尊居其中，施化行教太清境，大赤天神宝君说十二部经，其经号曰洞神部，其中一人为仙主。 第二上清境，是禹余天，灵宝君为教主，说十二部经，其经号曰洞玄部，其中一人为真主。 第三玉清境，清微天，天宝君说十二部经，其经号曰洞真部，其中一人为圣主，所谓仙真圣也。 大赤天为元气，其色白； 禹余天为玄气，其色黄； 清微天为始气，其色苍。 即行道登坛之时，无上三天玄元始三气是也。 何为名四等？ 一者唯慈，二者唯爱，三者唯善，四者唯忍。 何为名六度行？ 一者勤，二者信，三者雌，四者终，五者谏诤，六者断酒色。 何为名六根？ 一耳根，二眼根，三鼻根，四舌根，五心根，六身根。 根者，外未有对，内未有应，宜谓之根。 何为名六尘？ 眼以贪色为尘，耳以耽声为尘，鼻以香臭为尘，舌以察味为尘，身以细滑为尘，心以贪触为尘。 其六根过度即为六尘。 浊失其正性，又名六贼。 由人方便用之。 何为名四大？ 一者地大，为人骨肉； 二者水大，为人血脉； 三者火大，为人温暖； 四者风大，为人冷气。 何为名五荫？ 一者色荫，缘眼观一切色，名色荫。 二受荫，心觉是非苦乐，名受荫。 三想荫，心思惟，名想荫。 四行荫，心随想行，为名行荫。 五识荫，心知生灭，识想鉴记，名识荫。 何为名三业？ 一者身业，有杀盗淫。 二心业，有贪嗔痴。 三口业，有恶口两舌，妄言绮语，名为三业。 身三、意三、口四，即兼为十恶。 五苦：其五苦有生死二苦，生有五苦，死有五苦。 何为名生五苦？ 按《升玄经》云一者身为奴婢、忧悲别离。 二长处愚盲，不见妙道，与师父隔。 三鳏寡孤独，有人之形，无人之情。 四身遭横事，牢狱缠缚。 五虽曰长寿，疾病攻身，烦恼终日，是名生五苦。 何为名死五苦？ 一者履刀山剑树，手脚烂断。 二入镬汤沸涌之中，骨肉俱烂，生死轮回。 三身游饿鬼道中，衣不充形，食不满腹，吞火食炭。 四男抱铜柱，女卧铁床，剑树冲心，刃锋刺背。

chunks.original_text: 五纵得受生，还为六畜，任人鞭打，破领穿蹄。 是名死五苦。 何名三涂？ 涂者，役也。 一者地狱道，二饿鬼道，三畜生道。 兼五苦，即名八难。 何名三业？ 以前已有，一者身业，二者心业，三者口业。 就身业之中，复有三过：一者杀生过，二偷盗过，三邪淫过。 言一切众生，回手动足，常行杀害。 一切蠢动含血之类，不起慈心，或乘暗夜，行公然劫剥，或经过观舍，取三宝物。 命过之后，堕落三涂，恶鸟啄睛，铁犁耕舌，镕铜万沸，灌口烧身，累劫冥冥，无由解脱，以报前业之罪。 就心业之中，亦怀三毒：一者阴私毒，二贼害毒，三谗佞毒。 命过之后，在五浊汤中，昼夜煎煮，纵得受生，还为毒蛇恶兽，以报前身三毒之罪。 是名心业。 就口业之中，复有四罪：一者绮言，二者妄语，三者两舌，四者恶骂。 一切众生，在十方大地，华辞绮艳，翻覆两舌，说人长短，离人种亲，粗言恶气，更相骂詈，复以口业舌根，贪诸滋味，饮酒食肉及以荤辛。 命过之后，当没九幽，冥冥长夜之中，切切寒冰之狱。 假使慈悲父母，谁知苦爽含酸，虽有恩爱妻儿，岂见孤魂受痛？ 唯有三天教主、六道大师，哀愍众生，犹如赤子，惟慈惟爱，普救众生，降福降恩，援济含识。 御慈悲之救物，敬元始之洪恩，各各率励身心，一时敛意。 罪无大小，并乞消除，障有浅深，一朝忏尽，一心稽首，归依信礼。 唐天皇於中岳逍遥问三一法，潘尊师答曰：谨按《皇人守一经》存三守一之法，先心思存两眉间，却入三寸为上丹田之中，一神名赤子，字元先，一名帝卿，人长三寸，赤帻、赤衣、赤履。 次思心中丹田之中，一神名真人，字子丹，一名光坚，赤帻、赤衣、赤履，人长三寸。 次思脐下三寸为下丹田之中，一神名婴儿，字元阳子，一名谷玄子，赤帻、赤衣、赤履，人长三寸。 思见下一坐金床玉机，常以金炉玉匕搅精气讫。 思上一来下，往在中一左面，复思下一手持金炉玉匕，上在中一右面，先以精哺上中一计，令人得十三口，便思上一还所住，次思下一还所住讫便止。 真人曰：子能守一万事毕。 一者，身之帝君也。 守帝则帝在，帝在则三万六千神皆莫敢不在也。 思之可以却百鬼众精，五兵水火，众灾五毒，虎狼蛇蝗，蛟龙魍魉，山精鬼魅，不得近人耳。 唐天皇问曰：额上发际九宫，并是何宫？ 尊师答曰：谨按《登真隐诀经》，其发际以后九宫，一名双田宫，一名明堂宫，一名洞房宫，一名丹田宫，一名流珠宫，一名玉帝宫，一名天庭宫，一名极真宫，一名玄丹宫。 谨按《登真隐诀》，其头中两眉间上，都入三分为守寸双田，却入一寸为明堂宫，却入二寸为洞房宫，却入三寸为丹田宫，却入四寸为流珠宫，却入五寸为玉帝宫； 明堂上一寸为天庭宫，洞房上一寸为极真宫，丹田上一寸为玄丹宫，流珠宫上一寸为太皇宫。 凡一头中九宫也。 唐天皇问曰：六合宫在何处？ 尊师答曰：谨按《双景经》其六宫在眉后空处入皮一分，仍辟方九分是。 唐天皇问曰：道家阶梯，证果竟在何处？ 天师答曰：窃以法性常湛，真理唯寂，虽混成而有物，而虚廓无眹，机感所及，冥然已周，因教立名，厥义无量。 夫道者，圆通之妙称。
chunks.translated_text:
「Sixth, though **freed from suffering**, still one must endure the **Five Sufferings of Life** and be reborn as **livestock**, subjected to human lashes—**whips** breaking the neck, **hooves** piercing the body. This is named the **Five Sufferings of Death**.

What are called the **Three Filths**?
*Filth* refers to **bondage**. First is the **path of hell** (地狱道), second the **path of hungry ghosts** (饿鬼道), third the **path of livestock** (畜生道). Together with the **Five Sufferings**, this is named the **Eight Difficulties**.

What are called the **Three Karmas**?
They were previously mentioned: first, **physical karma** (身业), second, **mental karma** (心业), third, **verbal karma** (口业). Within **physical karma**, there are three transgressions: first, the **transgression of killing** (杀生过), second, the **transgression of theft** (偷盗过), third, the **transgression of licentiousness** (邪淫过).
All beings, with a mere turn of the hand or movement of the foot, habitually commit harm. All sentient creatures with blood—without mercy—either act under cover of darkness, plundering openly, or pass by temples and shrines, taking **sacred treasures**. After this transgression, one falls into the **Three Filths**, where **venomous birds** peck out the eyes, **iron plows** till the tongue, molten copper seethes in **boiling cauldrons**, poured into the mouth and burning the body. Through countless **kalpas** (劫) of endless darkness, there is no way to escape—this is the retribution for one’s prior **karma**.

Within **mental karma**, there are also three **poisons** (三毒): first, the **poison of deceit** (阴私毒), second, the **poison of harm** (贼害毒), third, the **poison of slander** (谗佞毒).
After this transgression, one endures the **Five Turbid Cauldrons** (五浊汤)—day and night, tormented by fire. Though reborn, one becomes a **venomous serpent** or **malevolent beast**, repaying the sins of the **Three Poisons** from a past life.
This is named **mental karma**.

Within **verbal karma**, there are four **offenses** (四罪): first, **deceptive speech** (绮言), second, **falsehood** (妄语), third, **double-tongued slander** (两舌), fourth, **malicious cursing** (恶骂).
All beings across the **Ten Directions** (十方) of the great earth indulge in **flowery, seductive words** (华辞绮艳), twist their tongues in **double-tongued slander**, speak ill of others, severing **kinship and lineage** (种亲), uttering **coarse, malevolent speech** (粗言恶气) and cursing one another. With **verbal karma**, the **root of the tongue** (舌根) craves **savory flavors**, drinking wine, eating meat, and indulging in **spicy, pungent** (荤辛) tastes.
After this transgression, one descends into the **Nine Abysses** (九幽), an endless night of **darkness and cold**, where one is imprisoned in **biting frost**.
Even if one is kind to **compassionate parents**, who would know the **bitter and sweet** (苦爽含酸) of their suffering? Though one has **affectionate spouses and children**, how could they witness the **lonely spirit enduring torment** (孤魂受痛)?
Only the **Three Celestial Teachers** (三天教主) and the **Six Path Masters** (六道大师) pity the suffering of all beings, like **a tender infant** (赤子), filled with **mercy and love**, universally saving all sentient beings, bestowing **blessings and grace**, aiding those with **sentience** (含识).
Under the **compassionate guidance** (御慈悲之救物) of the **Teachers of Mercy**, and the **great grace** (洪恩) of the **Primordial Sage** (元始), all strive to **purify mind and body**, gathering their intentions in one moment.
Whether the **offense is great or small**, all beg for its removal. Whether the **obstacle is shallow or deep**, all seek **atonement in a single day**. With **one heart**, they **bow in reverence**, taking refuge in **faith and devotion**.

The **Tang Emperor** (唐天皇) asked in **Mount Song** (中岳) about the **Triple Unity Method** (三一法). The **Revered Master** (尊师) replied:
*"In accordance with the *Scripture of the Sovereign’s Unity* (皇人守一经), the method of **Triple Unity** (三守一) is preserved. First, **cultivate unity** within the mind at the **space between the brows** (两眉间), then withdraw inward to the **upper elixir field** (上丹田), three inches deep. There is a **Divine Being** (神) named **赤子** (Child of Vermilion), with the **surname 元先** (Primordial First). Another name is **帝卿** (Lord of the Sovereign), with a height of three inches, wearing **vermilion headgear, vermilion robes, and vermilion shoes** (赤帻、赤衣、赤履).

Next, **cultivate unity** within the **middle elixir field** (心中丹田), where a **Divine Being** (神) named **真人** (True Person), with the **surname 子丹** (Elixir Child), is also called **光坚** (Radiant Strength), with three inches in height, wearing **vermilion headgear, vermilion robes, and vermilion shoes**.

Then, **cultivate unity** within the **lower elixir field** (脐下三寸), three inches below the navel, where a **Divine Being** (神) named **婴儿** (Infant), with the **surname 元阳子** (Primordial Yang Child), is also called **谷玄子** (Mysterious Valley Child), with three inches in height, wearing **vermilion headgear, vermilion robes, and vermilion shoes**.

Visualize the **lower unity** seated upon a **golden bed and jade couch** (金床玉机), constantly stirring the **refined vital essence** (精气) with a **golden censer and jade ladle** (金炉玉匕).

Then, **cultivate unity** from the **lower unity** to the **middle unity**, dwelling on its **left side**, and again, **cultivate unity** with the **lower unity**’s hand holding the **golden censer and jade ladle**, residing on the **middle unity**’s **right side**. First, **nourish the upper and middle unity** (上中一) with the **refined essence**, granting one **thirteen breaths** (得十三口). Then, return to **contemplate the dwelling place of the upper unity**, followed by **contemplate the dwelling place of the lower unity**, and then cease.

The **True Person** said: *"You can achieve **all things through Unity** (守一).*
**Unity** is the **Sovereign of the Body** (身之帝君). Guarding the **Sovereign** ensures the **Sovereign’s presence**, and when the **Sovereign is present**, the **thirty-six thousand spirits** (三万六千神) dare not fail to be present as well.
**Contemplating Unity** can repel **hundreds of ghosts and spirits** (百鬼众精), **five weapons** (五兵)—water and fire—**all calamities and five poisons** (众灾五毒), **tigers and wolves, snakes and locusts** (虎狼蛇蝗), **crocodiles, dragons, and malevolent specters** (蛟龙魍魉), **mountain spirits and demonic apparitions** (山精鬼魅), preventing them from approaching humans.

The **Tang Emperor** asked: *"The **Nine Palaces** (九宫) at the hairline on the forehead—what are their names?"*
The **Revered Master** replied:
*"In accordance with the *Scripture of Ascending to Truth and Hidden Secrets* (登真隐诀经), the hairline contains the **Nine Palaces** (九宫) behind the forehead. First is the **Double Field Palace** (双田宫), second the **Bright Hall Palace** (明堂宫), third the **Chamber Palace** (洞房宫), fourth the **Elixir Field Palace** (丹田宫), fifth the **Flowing Pearl Palace** (流珠宫), sixth the **Jade Sovereign Palace** (玉帝宫), seventh the **Celestial Court Palace** (天庭宫), eighth the **Ultimate Truth Palace** (极真宫), ninth the **Mysterious Elixir Palace** (玄丹宫).
In accordance with the *Hidden Secrets of Ascending to Truth* (登真隐诀), the **space between the brows** (两眉间) above the forehead is divided into three parts: the first inch is the **Double Field Palace** (守寸双田), the second inch is the **Bright Hall Palace** (明堂宫), the third inch is the **Chamber Palace** (洞房宫), the fourth inch is the **Elixir Field Palace** (丹田宫), the fifth inch is the **Flowing Pearl Palace** (流珠宫), and the sixth inch is the **Jade Sovereign Palace** (玉帝宫).
Above the **Bright Hall Palace**, one inch is the **Celestial Court Palace** (天庭宫); above the **Chamber Palace**, one inch is the **Ultimate Truth Palace** (极真宫); above the **Elixir Field Palace**, one inch is the **Mysterious Elixir Palace** (玄丹宫); and above the **Flowing Pearl Palace**, one inch is the **Supreme Sovereign Palace** (太皇宫).
Thus, there are **nine palaces** (九宫) within one head.

The **Tang Emperor** asked: *"Where is the **Six Harmony Palace** (六合宫)?"*
The **Revered Master** replied:
*"In accordance with the *Scripture of Double Vision* (双景经), the **Six Palaces** (六宫) are located behind the brows, one *fen* (分) deep into the skin, and further divided into nine sections, each nine *fen* (分) in size."*

The **Tang Emperor** asked: *"Where does the **Daoist path** (道家) culminate in **fruit and attainment** (证果)?*
The **Celestial Master** (天师) replied:
*"The **Law Nature** (法性) is always **serene and pure** (常湛), and **True Principle** (真理) rests in **stillness and emptiness** (唯寂). Though **mixed and transformed** (混成) and giving rise to **things** (有物), it is also **void and boundless** (虚廓), beyond perception. Yet, through **sensual responses** (机感), it subtly encompasses all. The **names** given in **teachings** (因教立名) are boundless in meaning.
The **Dao** (道) is the **wondrous name** (妙称) for **perfect harmony and unity** (圆通)."

chunks.original_text: 圣者，玄觉之至名。 一切有形，皆含道性。 然得道有多少，通觉有浅深。 通俗而不通真，未为得道，觉近而不觉远，非名圣人。 是以痛痒寒温，盖万物之小觉，转九结网，斯一艺之近通，然为道日疏，去圣逾远。 自非挺然玄悟，超然大通，焉能觉三界之沾危，通四生於寿域？ 斯盖以通通觉，令未觉者皆通以觉，觉通，使未通者皆觉，所以成大觉，於是号圆通。 然则唯法与人通，本通迹，色观则非有，应感则非无。 是以大道天尊，有真有应，真则湛然常住，不灭不生，应则有去有来，权示接引。 然真应两端，身亦不一，真身则为道本，应身则为化迹。 化迹劫劫出见，垂像流音，说经度人，不可称数，以无量大惠摄受群生。 一切众生，根性差别，故设科立教，渐顿有殊。 是诸行人，初发道意，起回向心，如说修行，先持净戒。 所言戒者，法有二种：一者有得戒，二者无得戒。 有得戒者，即《太玄真经》所谓三戒、五戒、九戒、十戒、百八十戒、三百大戒之例是也。 无得戒者，即谓上机之人，灵识惠解，业行精微，离诸有心，不婴尘染，体入空界，迹蹈真源，不求常乐而众善自臻，不厌人间而诸恶自息。 本自无持，今即不犯，无犯是名无得。 既其无得，亦复无失，无得故谓为真上机之人。 其戒如此，若能持戒不犯，登十转位，得五道果，言十转位，得五道果。 言十转位，按《海空智藏经》曰：一者无忧转，二净心转，三释滞转，四道儒转，五达解转，六善见转，七权物转，八了机转，九天明转，十具足转。 五道果者，经曰：果有五种，一者地仙果，二飞仙果，三自在果，四无漏果，五无为果。 若人修行服食休粮，研精道味，志慕山林，隐形栖遁，餐霞纳气，弃於甘腴，身轻体健，免於老死，游心道本，不食众生，行慈悲法，或生处贵家，所居华丽，身无疾恼，长斋蔬食，舍离淫欲，修如上法，则获地仙之果。 如人行诸善业，守护戒行，未尝缺犯，端身正心，休根绝谷，善持六根，不染垢污，行业模准，不越理度，游践名岳，餐饵云霞，静心坚固，安然不动，虽不广览大洞妙音，而守持净戒，如瑠璃珠内外明彻。 修如上术，即获飞仙之果。 如人善达禁戒，种种威仪，身心所行，冥合规矩，天人崇仰，莫不供养，神力变化，应见无方，志意所之，莫不必遂，不餐药饵，自然饱满，若欲食者，应念而至於此世间，形虑自在，游行山泽，得无惧心，常修善业，形随感起，心如山岳，习行神通，思微定於思微中，能分身形，应赴无量。 通此术者，则获自在果。 如人於一切法照了通达，於佗心行分别巨细，无有差失，利益无量，入空有际，经典悉皆受持，无复烦恼，贪嗔爱着，悉皆舍离，六入清浄，三结永断，晓了照达，辩才说法，广度众生，於一报内及至未来，终不退转，渐渐阶梯，至无上道。 勤修此法，则获无漏道果。 无为果者，即是入寂无上法门，寂境即是无为，无为即是寂境。 寂境者，不生不死，故能长生； 不毁不变，故能应变。 无为即是有为，有为即是无为。 以无为生有为，以有为入无为境，即是感应。 感应即是寂境，以寂境生感应，以感应归寂境，微妙莫测，神力难思，穷极深幽，故名解脱，是无为最上之果。

The **Sage** is the supreme name for **profound awareness** (玄觉). All things with form inherently contain the **Dao-nature** (道性). Yet, attaining the **Dao** varies in depth, and **enlightenment** ranges from shallow to profound.

To merely grasp the common and not the true is not to attain the **Dao**; to perceive the near but not the far is not to be called a **Sage**. Thus, sensations of pain, itching, cold, and warmth are but the trivial awareness of all things. Mastering the **Nine Net Bindings** (九结) is but a skillful proximity to understanding—yet this is daily distant from the **Dao**, ever farther from sainthood.

Only those who **uprightly** (挺然) awaken to **profound insight** (玄悟) and **transcendently** (超然) attain **great harmony** (大通) can perceive the perils of the **Three Realms** (三界) and guide all **Four Births** (四生) to the **Domain of Longevity** (寿域). This is achieved by **awakening through harmony**, making the unaware aware, and the unharmonized harmonized—thus perfecting **Great Awakening**, hence called **Round Enlightenment** (圆通).

Yet, the **Law** (法) and **humanity** (人) are inherently harmonized—**harmony as essence**, **trace as manifestation**. When perceived through **form**, it is not **being**; when responded to through **sensation**, it is not **emptiness**. Thus, the **Celestial Sovereign of the Great Dao** (大道天尊) embodies both **True** and **Responsive** aspects: the **True** abides **serene and eternal**, neither generated nor extinguished; the **Responsive** manifests with coming and going, **provisionally demonstrating** to guide beings.

Yet, the **True** and **Responsive** are twofold in form—**True Body** as the **Root of the Dao**, **Responsive Body** as **Manifested Trace**. Across **kalpas**, the **Manifested Trace** emerges, projecting forms and transmitting sounds, expounding **sutras** to guide beings—innumerable in **great compassion**, encompassing all living beings.

Since all beings differ in **root-nature** (根性), **teachings** are established in **graded stages** (科), with **progressive** and **sudden** methods varying.

For those who first awaken to the **Dao-intent**, cultivating **aspiration**, as taught, begin by upholding **pure precepts**. The **precepts** (戒) are of two kinds: **Precepts of Attainment** (有得戒) and **Precepts of Non-Attainment** (无得戒).

**Precepts of Attainment** are as described in the *Taixuan Zhenjing* (《太玄真经》): the **Three Precepts**, **Five Precepts**, **Nine Precepts**, **Ten Precepts**, **One Hundred and Eighty Precepts**, and the **Three Hundred Great Precepts**.

**Precepts of Non-Attainment** refer to those of **highest aptitude** (上机), whose **spirit-awareness** is enlightened, whose **conduct** is refined, and whose **actions** are subtle—free from **deliberate intent**, untouched by **defilements**, entering the **void-realm**, treading the **true source**. They attain **permanent bliss** without seeking, and **all virtues** arise spontaneously; they transcend the **human realm** without aversion, and **all evils** cease naturally. Since they inherently **hold nothing**, they inherently **transgress nothing**—this is called **Non-Attainment**.

Since there is no transgression, there is no loss. Thus, they are called **true high-aptitude beings**. Such are their precepts.

If one upholds the precepts without transgression, they ascend the **Ten Transformations** (十转位) and attain the **Five Dao Fruits** (五道果).

The **Ten Transformations** are as stated in the *Haikong Zhizang Jing* (《海空智藏经》):
1. **Transformation of No-Anxiety** (无忧转),
2. **Transformation of Pure Mind** (净心转),
3. **Transformation of Release from Hindrance** (释滞转),
4. **Transformation of Daoist Scholar** (道儒转),
5. **Transformation of Penetrating Insight** (达解转),
6. **Transformation of Auspicious Vision** (善见转),
7. **Transformation of Skillful Means** (权物转),
8. **Transformation of Clarifying Responses** (了机转),
9. **Transformation of Celestial Clarity** (天明转),
10. **Transformation of Fully Attained** (具足转).

The **Five Dao Fruits** are as follows:
1. **Earthly Immortal Fruit** (地仙果),
2. **Flying Immortal Fruit** (飞仙果),
3. **Self-Sovereign Fruit** (自在果),
4. **Leakless Fruit** (无漏果),
5. **Non-Action Fruit** (无为果).

If one cultivates through **alchemical practices**, abstaining from grains, refining **essence** and **Dao-flavor** (道味), aspiring to **mountain seclusion**, hiding their form in retreat, consuming **dew and qi**, rejecting **rich nourishment**, lightening the body and strengthening vitality, avoiding **aging and death**, wandering in **Dao-nature**, not consuming living beings, practicing **compassionate laws**, or if born into noble families, residing in splendor, free from illness, sustaining **long-term vegetarian fasting**, abandoning lust, and practicing as above—then they attain the **Earthly Immortal Fruit**.

If one performs **auspicious deeds**, safeguards **preceptual conduct**, never transgressing, maintaining **upright body and mind**, abstaining from **root desires**, skillfully holding the **Six Senses**, untouched by **defilements**, aligning actions with **principle**, not exceeding **measure**, wandering on **famed peaks**, feasting on **clouds and mist**, fortifying the mind, unmoved—even if they do not broadly hear **profound Dao-sounds**, yet they uphold **pure precepts** like a **lucent crystal**, clear within and without—then they attain the **Flying Immortal Fruit**.

If one masters **prohibitions and decorum**, their **conduct** and **mind** align with **rules**, revered by **heavenly and human**, all offering **sustenance**, their **spiritual power** transforming without limit, their **intentions** fulfilled—without consuming **elixirs**, naturally sated—if they wish to eat, it manifests by **thought alone** in this world, their **form and thoughts** unrestrained, wandering **mountains and marshes** without fear, perpetually cultivating **auspicious deeds**, their **form** responding to **sensations**, their **mind** steadfast as **mountains**, mastering **spiritual penetration**, meditating on **subtle stillness** within **subtle stillness**, able to **divide their form**, responding to countless calls—then they attain the **Self-Sovereign Fruit**.

If one **penetrates all laws**, discerning **heart-mind distinctions** without error, benefiting infinitely, entering **void and form**, receiving all **scriptures**, free from **afflictions**, abandoning **greed, anger, and attachment**, purifying the **Six Entries**, severing the **Three Bonds**, enlightened and penetrating, **eloquent in teaching**, broadly liberating beings—within this **lifetime** and future **kalpas**, never regressing, ascending **graded stages** to the **Supreme Path**—then through diligent cultivation, they attain the **Leakless Dao Fruit**.

The **Non-Action Fruit** is entering the **Supreme Stillness Path** (寂无上法门). **Stillness** is **Non-Action**; **Non-Action** is **Stillness**. **Stillness** is neither birth nor death, thus **eternal life**; it is neither destruction nor change, thus **adaptive response**. **Non-Action** is **Action**; **Action** is **Non-Action**. Through **Non-Action**, **Action** arises; through **Action**, one enters the **Non-Action realm**—this is **responsive harmony**.

**Responsive harmony** is **Stillness**; through **Stillness**, **responsive harmony** arises; through **responsive harmony**, one returns to **Stillness**—subtle and unfathomable, **spiritual power** beyond thought, exhausting **profound depths**, hence called **Liberation**—this is the **Supreme Fruit of Non-Action**.

chunks.original_text: 五果功成，十转行满，然后离三界缚，升出九清，证太一道，绍法王位，恶根永断，众德普会，三达洞照，五眼明彻。 非身离身，亦不不身，而以一形周遍六道。 非心离心，亦不不心，而以一念了一切法。 解众生性，即真道性； 一相无相，以此为无，而独能为万物之始。 以是义故，故称元始。 虽近遵一切，道为独尊，常处三清，出诸天上，八方五亿，诸天所尊，故称天尊。 尊义多名，略开五称，所谓道德中尊，智惠中尊，神通中尊，净妙中尊。 功德巍巍，赞咏难尽。 唐天皇问曰：天尊名号，有何阶级？ 尊师答曰：谨按灵宝诸经及三界图箓：道有三清三界。 其三清境者，则玉清、上清、太清； 三界者，则欲界、色界、无色界。 其下欲界有六天，其中色界有十八天，其上无色界有四天。 三界之上，复有四种人天，合有三十二天。 从四人天已下，三界之中，犹未免於三灾劫坏。 从无色界已上，则三灾所不及，劫会所不干。 其三清境中，各有一天，则清微天、禹余天、大赤天。 此三清三界，各有诸天帝皇，真仙品格，僚属极多，非可具述。 又有大罗天弥覆三清之上，合三清、大罗、三界等为三十六天。 其大罗天中有玉京山，山上有七宝城，城周旋二十四万里，高二万四千里。 城中有七宝玄台，九万层台，出城上三百六十里。 台上又生七宝之树，八株树高台上七百二十里，其树施枝布叶，弥覆城上八方无极之外。 其树以金银为根株，珠玉为枝柯，珊瑚夜光为树叶，□□、玛瑙、瑠璃、琥珀为子实，金银珠玉交错。 其间微风动条，枝叶集丽，赞咏洞章，玄焕曜目，四灵邕邕，宫殿楼观，难可称焉。 诸天帝王，大圣天尊，妙行真人，仙童玉女，皆各奉功朝修，洒扫、烧香、散花。 师子辟邪，神龙朱凤，悉皆飞翔。 灵兽侍卫，百千万种。 此山出五色流泉，又有九色光明，彻照大罗众天之上，虚皇大道元始天尊之所都。 故《度人经》曰：三界之上，眇眇大罗，上无色根，云层峨峨，唯有元始，浩劫之家。 即斯谓也。 常至三元八节诸是斋日，十方上圣，诸天帝皇，妙行真人，无鞅数众，并严天威羽服，各从十千万人，驾云乘龙，作天大乐，啸歌邕邕，十绝灵幡，飘流浮空而上，大会玄都，朝宗玉京元始天尊。 众圣皆烧香朝礼，飞行步虚，歌玄都之绝丽，叹宫阙之奇名。 众圣交观，非可名焉。 又《众篇经》曰； 太上大道君，高上玉帝，十方至真，并乘五色琼轮，琅舆碧辇，九色玄龙，十绝羽盖，三素流云。 诸天大圣，妙行真人，皆乘碧霞，九灵流景，飞云玉舆，庆霄四会，三晨吐芳，飞香八凑，流电激扬，华精灌日，三景合明，神霞焕烂，流盻太元。 从五帝神仙，桑林千真，师子白鹄，虎豹龙麟。 灵妃散华，金童扬烟，五道开涂，三界通津。 徘徊云路，啸咏十天，上诣三清大罗之上，太玄玉都寒灵丹殿，紫微上宫，建天宝羽服，诣元始天尊金阙之下，请受《元始灵宝赤书玉篇真文》。 天尊挺生神状，以道为身，非假因缘，而有待藉。 故《无量经》曰：元始祖劫，化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根。 上无复祖，唯道为身，应化济物，显号无穷，摄迹归真，则湛而为一。 以其诸天敬奉，号曰天尊。 为万有之根，故称元始。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Five Fruits** perfected, the **Ten Transformations** fulfilled—then one departs the **Three Realms’ bonds**, ascends to the **Nine Pure Ones**, attains the **Way of the Supreme One**, succeeds the **Law Sovereign’s station**, severs the **evil roots** forever, gathers all **virtues**, and illuminates the **Three Penetrations** with clarity, piercing the **Five Eyes**.

Not **body** apart from **body**, nor **not-body**—yet with **one form** pervading the **Six Paths**.
Not **mind** apart from **mind**, nor **not-mind**—yet with **one thought** encompassing all **dharma**.

Liberating all beings’ **nature** reveals the **True Way’s nature**; **one aspect without aspect**, taking this as **Non-Being**, yet alone able to be the **origin of all things**.

Thus, by this principle, it is called **Primordial Origin**.

Though it abides near all things, the **Way** stands alone supreme. Constantly dwelling in the **Three Pure Ones**, it transcends all heavens. The **eight directions**, the **five hundred myriads** of heavens—all reverence it, hence called **Heavenly Sovereign**.

The **Sovereign’s** name has many titles; briefly, the **Five Designations**:
The **Sovereign of Dao/Virtue**, the **Sovereign of Wisdom and Benevolence**, the **Sovereign of Divine Powers**, the **Sovereign of Purity and Marvel**.

Its **merits and virtues** are vast—praise cannot exhaust them.

The **Tang Emperor** asked: *"What are the ranks of the Heavenly Sovereign’s titles?"*
The **Master** replied: *"According to the *Lingbao Scriptures* and the *Three Realms Diagrams*: The **Way** has the **Three Pure Ones** and the **Three Realms**.

The **Three Pure Ones’ domains** are **Jade Pure**, **Upper Pure**, and **Supreme Pure**; the **Three Realms** are the **Realm of Desire**, the **Realm of Form**, and the **Realm of Formlessness**.

Below, the **Realm of Desire** has **six heavens**; within it, the **Realm of Form** has **eighteen heavens**; above, the **Realm of Formlessness** has **four heavens**.

Above the **Three Realms**, there are **four human-heavenly realms**, totaling **thirty-two heavens**.

From the **four human-heavens** downward, within the **Three Realms**, one is still subject to the **three calamities** and **effacing ages**.

From the **Realm of Formlessness** upward, the **three calamities** do not reach, nor do the **ages** interfere.

Within the **Three Pure Ones’ domains**, each has a heaven: **Pure Mists Heaven**, **Yu Remnant Heaven**, and **Great Red Heaven**.

These **Three Pure Ones and Three Realms**, each with their **heavenly emperors**, **true immortals of rank**, and countless attendants—too numerous to recount.

Above them, the **Great Luo Heaven** envelops the **Three Pure Ones**, making **thirty-six heavens** in total: the **Three Pure Ones**, **Great Luo**, and the **Three Realms**.

Within **Great Luo Heaven** lies **Jade Capital Mountain**, atop which stands a **seven-treasured city**, twenty-four myriads of *li* in circumference, twenty-four thousand *li* high.

Within the city is the **seven-treasured Mysterious Platform**, a **nine-million-tiered terrace**, rising three hundred sixty *li* above the city.

Upon the terrace grow **seven-treasured trees**, eight stalks each rising seven hundred twenty *li* above the terrace. Their branches and leaves spread beyond the city’s eight directions, infinite.

Their roots and trunks are of **gold and silver**, their branches of **pearls and jade**, their leaves of **coral and night-pearl**, their fruits of **□□, agate, lapis lazuli, and amber**, interwoven with gold, silver, pearls, and jade.

When the slightest breeze stirs the branches, the leaves gleam resplendent, their praise unfathomable, their radiance dazzling the eyes. The **four spirits** gather in reverence, their palaces and towers beyond description.

Heavenly emperors, **Great Saints**, **Heavenly Sovereigns**, **Mystery-Walking True Ones**, **Immortal Boys and Jade Girls**—all attend in service, sweeping, burning incense, scattering flowers.

**Lion-dogs** repel evil, **divine dragons and vermilion phoenixes** soar. **Spiritual beasts** guard in myriad kinds.

The mountain yields **five-colored flowing springs** and **nine-colored luminous light**, illuminating the **Great Luo multitudes** above, where the **Primordial Dao’s Heavenly Sovereign** resides.

Thus, the *Scripture of Salvation* says:
*"Above the Three Realms, vast and boundless is Great Luo—
Above formlessness, misty peaks rise—
Only the Primordial Origin remains,
The unshaken home of the Great Effacing."*

This is what is meant.

On the **Three Five and Eight Festivals**, and all **fasting days**, the **Ten Directions’ Saints**, heavenly emperors, **Mystery-Walking True Ones**, and countless **unnumbered multitudes**—all don **heavenly威羽服**, each with **ten thousand myriads**, riding **clouds and dragons**, playing **heavenly grand music**, singing in harmony, their **ten-perfect spirit banners** drifting through the void as they ascend to the **Celestial Gathering**, paying homage to the **Jade Capital Primordial Heavenly Sovereign**.

All the **Saints** burn incense in worship, flying through the **void**, singing of the **Celestial Capital’s** splendor, marveling at its **palaces’** famed grandeur.

The **Saints** gather in awe—beyond naming.

Again, the *Scripture of the Multitudes* says:
*"The Supreme Dao’s Great Sovereign, the Highest Jade Emperor, the Ten Directions’ Ultimate Truth—
All ride **five-colored jade wheels**, **lingyu carriages**, **spirit-pearl chariots**, **ten-perfect feathered canopies**, and **three-white flowing clouds**.
Heavenly Great Saints, **Mystery-Walking True Ones**—all ride **Azure Mist**, **Nine Spirits’ flowing light**, **flying-cloud jade carriages**, celebrating the **Four Celestial Gatherings**, the **Three Dawns’ fragrance**, **flying incense’s eight convergences**, **lightning’s flashing brilliance**, **flower-essence bathing the sun**, the **three luminaries’ convergence**, **divine clouds’ radiance**, and the **Primordial’s flowing light**.

From the **Five Emperors’ spirits**, the **Mulberry Grove Thousand Trues**, **lion-dogs and white geese**, **tigers, leopards, dragons, and unicorns**—
**Spiritual consorts** scatter flowers, **golden boys** waft incense, the **five paths** open, the **three realms’ ferries** connect.
They wander the **cloud paths**, singing the **Ten Heavens**, ascending to the **Three Pure Ones’ Great Luo** above, the **Supreme Mysterious Jade Capital’s Cold Spirit Hall**, the **Purple Micro Upper Palace**, donning **heavenly treasure羽服**, presenting themselves beneath the **Primordial Heavenly Sovereign’s golden gate**, to receive the *Primordial Lingbao Red Book Jade Chapter True Texts*.

The **Heavenly Sovereign** manifests the **divine form**, taking the **Way** as **body**—not relying on **contingent causes**, yet without dependence.

Thus, the *Scripture of Boundless* says:
*"Primordial Origin at the **Ancient Effacing**—
Transforming to birth all heavens,
Opening the **three luminaries**—this is the **heavenly root**.
Above, no further ancestor—
Only the **Way** as **body**,
Responding to transform and save,
Displaying the **Name of the Boundless**,
Retreating traces to return to **True One**—
Then serene, it becomes **One**.

Because all heavens revere it, it is called **Heavenly Sovereign**.
As the **root of all things**, it is called **Primordial Origin.**"

chunks.original_text: 诸真者，谨按道经：初从凡学，受持法戒，行无缺犯，则名系仙录，得入五岳灵山洞宫之中。 从洞宫中，进学无替，位登欲界诸天。 从欲界天中，进道无替，位登色界诸天。 从色界诸天，进道无替，位登无色界诸天。 从无色界诸天，进道无替，位登四种人天。 从四种人天，进道无替，位登无上三天。 从无上三天，进道无替，位登最上大罗之天。 从无色界以下三界天中，若不进修无上大道，则年劫有近远，三灾所及，未免劫中之期。 从四种人天已上，即是至道极果，毕竟不坏仙宫，与道同真，常湛极乐。 唐天皇问曰：太上道君已下何名人？ 潘尊师答曰：真途窈冥，绝诸色象，应迹森列，广现无边，故有三清三界之殊，九地九天之别。 诸天宫馆，各有方所，或大或细，不可胜言。 今则按《无量度人经》，有三十二天，三十二帝所居宫馆，各在其天。 道门经法相承次序卷上竟 道门经法相承次序卷中
chunks.translated_text:
The **Sages of All Truths**, in strict accordance with the Daoist scriptures, are those who:

First, from the realm of the mundane, **learn the Dao** and **hold fast to its laws and precepts**, never failing in their practice—then they are **enrolled in the Celestial Register of Immortals**, gaining entry to the **Luminous Mountains and Sacred Caverns of the Five Peaks**.

From the **Sacred Caverns**, advancing **without interruption in their studies**, they ascend to the **Heavens of the Realm of Desire**.

From the **Heavens of the Realm of Desire**, progressing **without interruption in the Dao**, they attain the **Heavens of the Realm of Form**.

From the **Heavens of the Realm of Form**, advancing **without interruption in the Dao**, they reach the **Heavens of the Realm of Formlessness**.

From the **Heavens of the Realm of Formlessness**, advancing **without interruption in the Dao**, they ascend to the **Four Kinds of Human-Heavenly Realms**.

From the **Four Kinds of Human-Heavenly Realms**, advancing **without interruption in the Dao**, they attain the **Supreme Three Heavens**.

From the **Supreme Three Heavens**, advancing **without interruption in the Dao**, they ascend to the **Highest Great Luo Heaven**.

Yet, from the **Heavens of the Realm of Formlessness and below**, if one does not **pursue and refine the Supreme Dao**, then the **proximity or distance of kalpas** will vary, and the **Three Calamities** will befall them—**not escaping the fate of the kalpas**.

From the **Four Kinds of Human-Heavenly Realms** and above, they have reached the **ultimate fruit of the Dao**, forever unshaken in their **Sacred Abodes**, **conjoined with the Dao in True Reality**, perpetually abiding in **Serene Supreme Bliss**.

The **Tang Heavenly Sovereign** asked: *"What are the names of those below the **Highest Dao Sovereign**?"*

**Pan the Venerable Master** replied: *"The **True Path** is profound and mysterious, transcending all **phenomenal forms and colors**. Its manifestations are vast and boundless, hence the distinction between the **Three Pure Ones** and the **Three Realms**, and the differentiation of the **Nine Earthly Regions** and **Nine Celestial Levels**.

The **Heavenly Palaces and Abodes** each possess their own **domain and expanse**, some grand, some modest—**too numerous to recount**.

Now, in accordance with the *Scripture of Boundless Salvation*, there are **Thirty-Two Heavens**, each with its own **Palace and Abode** where the **Thirty-Two Celestial Emperors** reside, all within their respective **Heavenly Realms**.

**The Dao Gate’s Scriptures on the Transmission of Laws and Precepts, Volume One, completed.**
**The Dao Gate’s Scriptures on the Transmission of Laws and Precepts, Volume Two, begun.**"

chunks.original_text: 洞真及登真诀云 太明宫，　　玉霄琳房，　　玉晨宫， 协晨宫，　　七灵台，　　　凤台， 琼阁，　　　晨华阙，　　　太和殿， 寥阳殿，　　紫珠闼，　　　七映房， 长楼。 右玉晨道君所居。 丹灵白玉宫，琼阙。 右太素三元君所居。 真阳宫。 右玉皇君之所居处。 太老寝堂。 右八皇老时入此堂。 会方宫。 右九老仙皇君所居。 散华台。 右二十七皇道君治其上。 瑶台琼阙。 中藏金玄羽章万神隐文。 右高上玉帝藏其真经之所。 七映紫台中，藏步蹑天纲空常内名。 龙山台，秀玄台，大晖殿。 右地皇上真所游处。 三华房。 右阳安元君之所居。 玉清宫。 右高上玉帝元始天王太真之馆。 紫瑶宫，丹琼府。 右北玄高上虚皇君所居。 网灵宫，化生府。 右南朱高上虚皇君所居。 光音宫，八坦府。 右西华高上虚皇君所居。 紫微宫，朱霍府。 右东明高上虚皇君所居。 金灵宫，凤啸府。 右中元中合虚皇君所居。 凤生宫，洞光府。 右五灵七明混生高上君所居。 明范宫，辉华府。 右三元无上玄老灵皇元辰君所居。 七瑶宫，北元府。 右玄寂无上虚皇君所居。 郁森宫，八琼府。 右大明灵晖中真无上君所居。 灵雾宫，霄上府。 右三元四极玄上元灵君所居。 洞霄宫，演真府。 右三元晨中黄景虚皇元台君所居。 返香宫，夙滞府。 右三元紫映晖神虚生真元胎君所居。 琼容宫，太丹府。 右青精上真内景君所居。 琼光宫，通灵府。 右太阳九气玉贤元君所居。 已上宫台馆府，并在玉清妙境。 寒灵丹殿。 右元始天王下教命五老仙都，出《玉佩金珰宝经》，以传高圣玉晨大道君所居。 广灵堂 右太素三元君所居。 晨灯台。 右元始天王刻书紫微宫，飞天检文於其上。 金牖台。 右元始天王刻书玄空飞天中，书三元玉检文於其上。 三元玄台。 右历万八千劫，则三天九灵上彻，隐文一现於其上。 明真宫，灵晖府。 右太初九素金华景元君所居。 紫曜宫，七宝府。 右九皇上真司命君所居。 通妙宫，定微府。 右天皇上真玉华三元君所居。 天皇宫，玉灵府。 右太一上元禁君所居。 金华宫，紫生府。 右元虚皇房真晨君所居。 四明宫，八朗府。 右太极四真人元君所居。 华晨宫，魁元府。 右四计中真士晨散华君所居。 七灵宫，机玄府。 右辰中皇景元君所居。 金阙宫，玉真府。 右后圣太平李真天帝上景君所居。 无量宫，玄阙府。 右太虚后圣元景彭室真君所居。 太玄宫，玉堂府。 右太玄都九气丈人主仙君所居。 清虚宫，洞清府。 右上清八景老君所居。 清元宫，旸谷府。 右扶桑大帝九老仙皇君所居。 金灵宫，通气府。 右小有王真华先生主图王君所居。 司空宫，仙都府。 右玄州二十七真相伯上帝司禁君所居。 宝素宫，九玄府。 右龟山九灵真仙母所居。 常阳宫，九生府。 右上始少阳青帝君所居。 洞阳宫，朱陵府。 右通阳纳阴赤帝君所居。 金门宫，通光府。 右少阴西金白帝君所居。 广灵宫，北黄府。 右通阴太阳黑帝君所居。 黄元宫，高皇府。 右总灵高皇帝君所居。 已上道君宫殿杂宝玄堂在上清妙境。 洞玄经曰： 太素宫。 右太素道君所居。 太和宫。 右太和大道君所居。 金华楼。 右仙真玉录皆在楼中。 已前宝楼绮宫，在太清妙境极乐之所。 唐天皇问曰：天尊有几身，为弟子已不能苦道上启天尊，覆护弟子？

chunks.original_text: 天师对曰：可名非名，故证理於绝言之境； 大象无象，故升玄於无物之间。 若唯恍惚，杳冥众生，可无瞻仰，所以垂象立号，令含识各有归依。 无始以来，劫数久远，圣人应号，亦复无边，虽不总备经文，实亦纪之万一，即事可显者，千五百天尊，名别录随进。 按诸经所明，天尊有法身、本身、道身、真身、迹身、应身、分身、化身。 谨按《太上开演秘密藏经》曰：太上言，此经名为开演秘密之藏，义如我等比无上法王，出此五浊，化诸众生三业，示现方便，善巧意趣，微隐难可了知。 所以示者，十方天尊所得妙身，即真道相体，自然无形无名，非造非作，法如虚空相。 无数劫来，久证此法同，一性平等无二，而能出现种种法身，示修习报应，化无方人天恶道。 随类所见，受生业行，皆同其法，或现殊胜，超踰世间，第一希有，独步无畏，威变自在，不可思议，是名开演身秘密藏。 能於正道真实之性天尊无说寂灭相中，善巧因缘，分别显示，随其所宜，说法无尽，言辞次第，义味深赜，或说三乘，入天业果，渐渐开化，使得同归真一正道，是名开演口秘密藏。 虽无念虑，离分别想，以一切智，洞达空门正观，穷理边底，与真实相平等为一，以一切智照人间法，色法非法，心法非心法，人天五道，四大六尘，众生想念，果报因缘，於一念中明了无碍，善识根性，随宜所行，洞达究意，是名开演心秘密藏。 以是三种秘密之法，成真道身，非是凡夫了至，九星所能觉知。 法身天尊者，谨按《升玄经》曰：吾以三气周环八极，或号元始，或号老君，或号太上，或为帝师，或为玄宗，出幽入冥，待应无方，随人所好，为作法身。 同归之趣，非为缘异，愚者不体，相与(女十自)贤，吾愍口过，敢陈其源。 道之布气，在於无边无形无像，留住经文，不自巧饰，诚惟修身，其身得真，既得真像，自然登晨。

The Celestial Master replied:

*"It may be named yet not named, thus attaining the truth beyond all speech;
The Great Form is formless, thus ascending to the Mysterious between nothingness.
If only vague and indistinct, lost in the murk of sentient beings,
there would be no need for manifestations and titles—
yet symbols are established and names bestowed,
so that all conscious beings may have their proper refuge.

Since beginningless time, through countless kalpas,
the Sage’s titles have been without end.
Though not exhaustively recorded in scriptures,
they are indeed chronicled in a hundredth part—
and those matters clearly manifest,
the *Separate Record of the Five Hundred Celestial Venerables*,
is presented accordingly.

According to the scriptures’ teachings,
the Celestial Venerable possesses:
the **Dharma-body**, the **Original-body**, the **Dao-body**, the **True-body**, the **Trace-body**, the **Manifestation-body**, the **Fractional-body**, and the **Transformation-body**.

Carefully examining the *Supreme Scripture of Unveiling the Secret Treasure*:
The Supreme One spoke:
*'This scripture is named *Unveiling the Secret Treasure*,
its meaning like that of the peerless Dharma King—
emerging from the Five Turbidities,
transforming all sentient beings in their threefold karma,
demonstrating expedient means with skillful intent,
subtly hidden yet difficult to comprehend.

Thus, the demonstration:
The wondrous bodies attained by the Celestial Venerables of the ten directions
are the true essence of the Dao’s form,
naturally formless and nameless,
neither fabricated nor contrived—
their law is like the emptiness of space.
Through countless kalpas,
they have long verified this same law—
one undivided essence, yet able to manifest
various Dharma-bodies,
teaching sentient beings of the six realms
to cultivate retribution and transformation,
free from worldly suffering and fear,
their power and transformations boundless,
beyond conception—
this is called the *Secret Treasure of the Unveiled Body*.

Within the Celestial Venerable’s true and real nature,
beyond all spoken extinction,
skillfully employing causes and conditions,
they distinguish and display teachings endlessly,
their words ordered, meanings profound—
sometimes expounding the Three Vehicles,
leading to heavenly retribution,
gradually transforming all to return to the One True Dao—
this is called the *Secret Treasure of the Unveiled Speech*.

Though free from thought and discrimination,
with all-knowing wisdom penetrating the true gate of emptiness,
exhausting the limits of principle,
equal to the true and real,
with all-knowing wisdom illuminating human laws—
color is not a law, mind is not a mind-law,
the Five Paths of human and heavenly realms,
the Four Great Elements and Six Dusts,
sentient beings’ thoughts and retributions,
causal conditions—
all are clearly understood in a single thought,
discerning roots and nature,
acting as appropriate,
penetrating to the utmost intent—
this is called the *Secret Treasure of the Unveiled Mind*.

Through these three kinds of secret laws,
the True Dao-body is perfected—
not something ordinary mortals or the Nine Stars can comprehend.

The Celestial Venerable of the **Dharma-body**:
Carefully examining the *Scripture of Ascending to the Mysterious*:
*'I, with the Three Qi circulating the eight extremes,
am called Yuan Shi, or Lao Jun, or Tai Shang,
or Imperial Teacher, or Mysterious Sovereign—
entering the obscure, emerging from the void,
responding without bounds,
adapting to the people’s desires,
thus manifesting the Dharma-body.
The convergence of all paths is not for different causes—
the foolish fail to grasp this,
yet the wise recognize it.
I pity those who speak in vain,
daring to reveal its source.

The Dao’s diffusion of qi
lies in the boundless, formless, imageless—
scriptures remain, yet not adorned by artifice.
Only through sincere self-cultivation
does one attain the true form,
and upon attaining the true form,
naturally ascending to the morning."*

chunks.original_text: 此法玄妙，玄之又玄，愚者失趣，或谓非神，相与竞笑，攻本伐根。 按《太上洞极最胜无等道集经》曰：尔时十方天尊，来到此土，依域而住，各於殿内而说赞曰： 元始无上第一尊，超踰十方无等伦。 无数劫来积妙行，具足清浄福惠因。 烦恼结习皆已断，毕竟故业不造新。 神通威力无所畏，洞达三界了悟真。 圆备智慧诸功德，集此妙法以为身。 本身天尊者，谨按《宝玄经》云：太上曰，本寂应动，真假有殊，权实众妙，同出玄门。 又按《太上开演秘密藏经》曰：帝君曰，如是本身，能生万物，即是万物之本始者，此与神本有何差别？ 太上答曰； 源其实体，无有二相。 何以故？ 俱毕竟故，无始终故，不可言说故。 以善方便，亦得言异。 所谓神本，是妄想物，一念想续，众生业果轮转无穷，是名识物，亦名神本。 言本身者，即是道性。 清净之心，能为一切，出万法之根本，故名为本始。 是真性，非心不心，非色不色。 无缘虑故，非无常故，故言非心； 能生心故，无不知故，亦名为心。 无所得故，故名非色； 能生色故，道眼见故，亦名为色。 是清净心，具足一切，无量功德，智慧成就，常住自在，湛然安乐，但为烦恼所覆蔽，故未得了，故名为性。 若修方便，断诸烦恼，障法尽故，显现了故，名为本身。 如此身者，本自有之，非今造故，故名为本。 非有性，非三代，摄方便说故，故非三代。 本来有故，名为过去。 一切众生，毕定当得，故名未来。 十方大圣，今已得故，故名见在。 虽复说有，三代差别，体不动故，常住无变。 道身天尊者，谨按《太上灵宝无量度人经》云：元始祖劫，化生诸天，开明三景，是为天根。 上无复祖，唯道为身。 又按《太上开演秘密藏经》曰：太上大道君与无量天真妙行真人，俱诣太微天帝君处，明霞之上琼阙之内，金华之房。 太微帝君稽首：道君不审三代十方天尊所得妙身，以何为法，为同一体，为各异耶？ 太上告曰：至真妙理，寂绝无形，清净凝湛，不可言名。 方便引化，略开二途：一者，道身寂体虚无； 二者，生身诞孕形躯。 言道身者，离一切相，正慧成满，断除虚妄，冥契玄宗，与道为一，不灭不生，无来无去，谈论路断，念虑长毕。 帝君礼曰：不审道身即是寂本，唯更有义名为本耶？ 太上告曰：道为圣本，本是道根，虽是一体，非无二源。 道名独立，体自虚通，强字无待。 远逝息功，本对於末，因待假名，称为物始，用涉能生。 又为迹本，动寂用殊，出没物表，语嘿相须。 於是道君欲显玄理，重说偈曰： 道身不生灭，任理自玄通。 湛然常清净，独立强言空。 绝名不待对，亦妄造物功。 端静息义用，肃寂守虚冲。 真身天尊者，按《仙公请问经》曰：得道之尊，并由积德行善，论身炼神，故致成真。 又《太上决疑经》曰：元始天尊时在协晨灵观棱层之台，与太上大道君及十二亿童真上圣俱坐白玉师子之座，俱宣秘要，开阐妙门，自非天尊同业，共行入道界人，不豫斯会。 复以神力震动大地，周回旋转，惊骇物心。 当尔之时，三恶众生皆得休假，人天之报，各蒙增益，无诸苦恼障难之厄，莫不一时远近俱集，其众无量，不可胜言。 是时大众，咸同一心，瞻仰道君，目不暂胸而说偈曰：
