This law is profound and recondite—profound beyond profundity—
the foolish lose their way, some calling it not divine,
mocking and competing, attacking the root and uprooting it.

According to the *Supreme Dao’s Perfection of the Ultimate Unsurpassed Dao Collection Scripture*:
At that time, the Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions
came to this land, dwelling according to their realms,
each within the halls reciting praises thus:

*"The Primordial, Supreme, First and Highest Sovereign,
transcending the Ten Directions without equal.
Through countless kalpas, accumulating wondrous deeds,
possessing perfect purity and boundless virtue and blessings.
All defilements and habitual bonds severed,
past karma exhausted, no new deeds created.
Divine powers and might unobstructed,
penetrating the Three Realms, awakening to the True.
Perfect wisdom and all virtues gathered—
this wondrous law is made into the body."*

The Original Body Celestial Worthies, according to the *Treasure of the Mysterious Scripture*:
The Supreme One said: *"The Original is quiescent yet responsive, true and false differ,
provisional and real—all marvels arise from the Mysterious Gate."*

Again, according to the *Supreme Opening of the Secret Treasury Scripture*:
The Imperial Lord said: *"This Original Body, able to generate all things,
is itself the Original Beginning of all things—
what difference is there between this and the Divine Origin?"*

The Supreme One replied:
*"Its source and substance are without duality.
Why? Both are ultimately so—
without beginning or end, unspeakable.
Through skillful means, distinctions may be spoken of.
What is called the Divine Origin is mere imagined things—
a single thought’s continuation,
and the wheel of sentient beings’ karma turns endlessly—
this is called recognizing things, also called the Divine Origin.
What is called the Original Body is the Dao-nature.
The pure mind, able to do all things,
is the root of all dharmas—
thus called the Original Beginning.
This is true nature—
neither mind nor non-mind, neither form nor non-form.
Without entangling deliberation, thus not impermanent—
hence called non-mind;
yet it generates mind, knowing nothing—
also called mind.
Without acquisition, thus called non-form;
yet it generates form, seen by the Dao-eye—
also called form.
This pure mind possesses all virtues,
boundless merit, accomplished wisdom,
ever-abiding, self-so, serene and blissful—
yet obscured by defilements, thus not yet realized—
hence called nature.
If through skillful means one severs all defilements,
the obstructions exhausted, clarity revealed—
this is called the Original Body.
Such a body is inherently possessed,
not newly created—
thus called Original.
Not a fixed nature, not the Three Times*—
yet encompassing expedient speech—
thus not the Three Times.
Originally existing—hence called Past.
All sentient beings will inevitably attain it—
hence called Future.
The Great Saints of the Ten Directions have already obtained it—
hence called Present.
Though spoken of as having the Three Times,
its essence is unchanging, ever-abiding and unaltered."*

The Dao-Body Celestial Worthies, according to the *Supreme Spirit-Treasury Scripture of Infinite Salvation*:
*"In the Primordial Ancestral kalpa,
the transformations gave birth to all heavens,
illuminating the Three Lights*—
this is the Heavenly Root.
Above, no further Ancestor—
only the Dao as body."*

Again, according to the *Supreme Opening of the Secret Treasury Scripture*:
The Supreme Dao Lord and the countless Heavenly True Persons of Wondrous Practice
together visited the Imperial Lord of Taiwei at the Jade Terrace above the Azure Mists,
within the Golden Flower Chamber.
The Taiwei Emperor kowtowed: *"Lord Dao, I do not understand
whether the Celestial Worthies of the Three Times and Ten Directions,
having obtained this wondrous body,
do so by the same law or by different bodies?"*

The Supreme One replied:
*"The most true and wondrous principle—
quiescent, formless, pure and serene—
unspeakable.
Through skillful transformation, two paths are briefly opened:
First, the Dao-Body’s quiescent, void essence;
Second, the Generated Body’s born and formed physique.
What is called the Dao-Body:
free from all marks,
perfect true wisdom fulfilled,
severing illusions,
mystically harmonizing with the Mysterious Sovereign,
one with the Dao—
neither extinction nor generation,
no coming nor going,
discourse ceases, thoughts exhausted."*

The Emperor bowed: *"I do not understand—
is the Dao-Body itself the quiescent Original,
or is there another called the Original?"*

The Supreme One replied:
*"The Dao is the Sacred Original,
the Original is the Dao’s root—
though one in essence, not without two sources.
The Dao stands alone,
its body naturally void and penetrating,
strongly named without dependence.
Far-reaching and still, its function exhausted—
the Original faces the End,
relying on provisional names,
called the Origin of things,
its use generating.
Also called the Trace-Original,
dynamic and quiescent in function,
appearing and vanishing beyond things,
silent and dependent on marks."*

Then the Dao Lord wished to reveal the Mysterious Principle
and spoke again in verse:

*"The Dao-Body neither generates nor perishes,
following its nature, naturally profound and penetrating.
Serene and ever pure,
independent—strongly called void.
Cutting off names, needing no counterpart,
yet falsely creating things’ functions.
Silent and still, exhausting meaning’s use,
solemn and quiescent, guarding the void’s surge."*

The True-Body Celestial Worthies, according to the *Scripture of the Immortal’s Questions*:
*"Those who attain the Dao’s worthiness
do so through accumulating virtue and doing good,
refining the body and tempering the spirit—
thus achieving the True."*

Again, according to the *Supreme Scripture of Resolving Doubts*:
*"The Primordial Celestial Worthies, at the time of the Coherent Dawn,
stood upon the Linguan Terrace,
with the Supreme Dao Lord and twelve hundred million Childlike Saints
seated together on the White Jade Lion Throne,
all proclaiming secret essences,
opening wondrous gates—
only Celestial Worthies of the same practice,
those who walk the Dao’s path together,
were present at this assembly.
With divine power, they shook the great earth,
spinning and revolving,
startling the hearts of all things.
At that time, the three kinds of malevolent beings
all obtained respite,
and the rewards of humans and devas
were each augmented—
free from all sufferings, obstacles, and calamities,
near and far, all gathered instantly—
their numbers boundless, beyond reckoning.
Then the great assembly, in unison,
gazed upon the Dao Lord,
their eyes never blinking,
and recited this verse:"*

The convergence of all paths is not for different causes—
the foolish fail to grasp this,
yet the wise recognize it.
I pity those who speak in vain,
daring to reveal its source.

The Dao’s diffusion of qi
lies in the boundless, formless, imageless—
scriptures remain, yet not adorned by artifice.
Only through sincere self-cultivation
does one attain the true form,
and upon attaining the true form,
naturally ascending to the morning."*

chunks.original_text: 元始无上天人师，今舍大慈离生死。 独反善寂妙一源，不住世间济尘滓。 真智淳净无碍身，譬喻言辞莫能拟。 非是我等所知见，何能观之悟玄理。 迹身天尊者，谨按《太上开演秘密藏经》曰：帝君又问生身、迹身是应作耶？ 太上答曰：如是如是，生之与迹，并称机缘，利益不差，即名为应，体用不别，随义异名。 帝君又问：是迹身者，为有法耶，为无法耶？ 太上答曰：我不说耶，一切诸法，性无所有，云何迹身，而当有法？ 若假名字，亦有亦无。 不离本故，故名为无； 众生见故，故名为有； 更无别体，故名为无； 有实利益，故名为有。 犹如明镜，能现色像，了了分明，种种差别。 是镜中像，不可定说，是有是无，而亦得言镜中有像。 一切众生心镜明，故见真道像，又如止水无涛波，故影见日月星辰、飞鸟，悉见水底一切诸物，亦见自影，了了分明。 此水中物及所见影，俱非真实，不可言有，不可言无。 一切众生，心水清澄，见道身影，亦复如是。 体印真道，是故非有非不见，故不得言无。 如追逝者寻迹，然得是迹与人，非一非异，迹身亦尔。 明解之人，因迹入悟，见真道身，知无迹法，故名为一。 非不因迹，渐得晓达，能立福田，是名为异。 如是之义，是道境界，非是凡夫下圣能了。 於是道君欲显斯义，重说偈言： 权迹无定方，现身亦长久。 逼示五道形，姿容顺妍丑。 任本之所重，利益无忧负。 乍有变化生，时或因父母。 应身天尊者，谨按《老君经教》云：圣真无鞅，大要有二。 一者道精神气，降应成形，形以同人，人未还本。 二者凡夫积学，功行备充，神与应合，隐而无名。 道应随缘，缘本无名，出应有号，出号异应，号异道同，动不离寂。 又按《太上决疑经》云：元始天尊曰，为众生故现应受身，游入五道，称缘开度，随宜方便，皆使悟入，称物根性，权示色像，故名应身。 而此应身，亦无生灭去来，常住不变，为利一切，隐显不同，发起精进，令无退转。 是时众仙转拜道君而说偈曰： 无上净妙真智身，寂灭无相莫能睹。 但见应体还本源，是故各怀大忧苦。 仰赖太上无极尊，犹如失母依慈父。 我等没在忧火中，惟愿时澍甘露雨。 断绝倒想恋着心，消除诸见灭邪趣。 分身天尊者，谨按《灵书度命经》曰：天尊分形百万，处处同时，是男是女，普见天尊在五色光中，如俱一地，随所在处，长幼男女，皆往稽首。 天尊随其国土，说演十部妙经，授以禁诫，宣示男女。 是时四方边境男女长幼，莫示福心，各赍金银、五色纹缯、珠玉、珍宝，无鞅亿数，来送天尊，伏受法诫，尊承妙经。 七日七夜，光明朗除，四方复常，诸国宝信，满一国中。 天尊一时布赐穷困，饥者饱足，贫者不乏，贫富齐等，人无怨心。 上天校录，先有善功，名书金简，皆得度世，飞行太空，始入法门，普皆长寿三万六千年。 又按《太上洞极最胜无等道集经》曰：元始天尊三日三夜安然不动，诸根寂灭，入甚深定，洞观妙门，一切大众皆亦端拱，瞻仰尊颜，无一差跌。 过三日已，元始天尊举身含笑，遍体放光，纯黄金色普照大众，发微妙音赞道君曰：善哉善哉！ 我之真子，能绍尊位，教化众生，启方便门，与我无异。
chunks.translated_text:
The Primordial Supreme Lord of Heaven and Humankind,
now abandons great compassion and departs from birth and death.
Alone returning to the wondrous, silent source of goodness,
he does not dwell in the world to benefit the dust of mortals.

The pure, unobstructed body of true wisdom—
no metaphor or speech can liken it.
Not something within our knowing or seeing,
how could we observe it and awaken to profound truth?

The Celestial Worthies of the trace-body,
carefully consulting the *Supreme Scripture of Unveiling the Secret Treasury*,
asked: *"Does the Dao Lord manifest both the birth-body and the trace-body?"*

The Supreme Lord replied: *"So it is. Birth and trace—
both are called 'opportunity,' benefiting without distinction,
thus named 'manifestation.' Essence and function are not separate,
names differ according to meaning.*

*The Dao Lord further asked: *"Is the trace-body one with the Dharma or without?"*

*The Supreme Lord answered: *"I do not say 'yes.' All things,
in their nature, are without possession.
How could the trace-body be said to have Dharma?
If only a name is assumed, then it is both and not both—
not separate from its origin, hence called 'not having';
seen by sentient beings, hence called 'having';
no other substance, hence called 'not having';
yet truly beneficial, hence called 'having.'

*Like a bright mirror that reflects myriad forms,
clear and distinct, yet the images within it
cannot be fixed as having or not having—
yet one may say the mirror holds images.
When the minds of all beings are clear,
they see the true Dao-body’s reflection—
like still water without waves,
reflecting sun, moon, stars, and flying birds,
all clearly seen at the water’s depths,
along with their own shadow, distinct and bright.

*These watery things and their shadows
are neither truly real nor can be said not to exist.
When all beings’ minds are clear and pure,
they see the Dao-body’s reflection—
just so.
The true Dao is imprinted upon them,
thus neither having nor unseen—
hence it cannot be called 'not having.'
Like one who pursues the past by tracing footsteps,
yet finds neither the trace nor the person—
neither one nor different.
The trace-body is the same.

*Those who understand clearly,
entering through the trace to awaken,
see the true Dao-body,
knowing the trace-Dharma is nonexistent—
thus it is called 'one.'
Not that it does not rely on the trace,
but gradually attaining comprehension,
establishing fields of merit—
this is called 'different.'

*Such is the Dao’s realm,
not something the vulgar or lowly saints can fathom.*

*Then the Dao Lord wished to reveal this meaning,
reciting another verse:*

*The trace-body has no fixed form,
its manifested body endures eternally.
It presses upon the Five Paths’ shapes,
its form adapts to beauty or ugliness.
Prioritizing its essence,
it benefits without burden or neglect.
Sometimes it generates transformations,
at times it follows father and mother.
The Celestial Worthies of the trace-body,
consulting the *Scriptures of the Old Lord’s Teachings*, say:
The Sacred and True are without constraint,
their essence has two aspects:
One—Dao-qi descending to manifest form,
harmonizing with mortals, yet mortals not yet returning to the root.
Two—when the vulgar cultivate with complete virtue,
their spirit merges with manifestation,
hidden yet unnamed.

*The Dao responds to circumstances;
circumstances are without name,
yet manifestations are named.
Names differ, manifestations differ,
yet the Dao remains the same—
action never leaves stillness.*

*Further, consulting the *Supreme Scripture of Resolving Doubts*, it says:
The Primordial Celestial Worthies declared,
*"For the sake of sentient beings, I manifest and receive form,
entering the Five Paths, adapting to circumstances to guide them,
using expedient means to awaken all,
conforming to their roots and nature,
demonstrating forms by expedient means—
thus it is called the 'manifestation-body.'
Yet this manifestation-body
has neither birth nor death, coming nor going—
it is ever-present, unchanging,
benefiting all, hidden or revealed,
arousing diligence so none retreat."*

*At that time, the assembled immortals bowed repeatedly to the Dao Lord,
reciting this verse:*

*The Supreme, pure, and wondrous body of true wisdom,
silent and extinguished, formless—none can perceive it.
Only the manifestation-body returns to its source,
thus all bear great sorrow and distress.
Relying on the Supreme Lord of the Boundless,
like an orphan clinging to a father’s mercy,
we are immersed in the fire of suffering—
we pray for the timely rain of sweet dew.
Severing inverted thoughts and clinging hearts,
dissolving all views and evil inclinations.*

*The Celestial Worthies of the divided-body,
consulting the *Scripture of the Spirit’s Degree and Fate*, say:
The Celestial Worthies divided their forms into a hundred million,
simultaneously present everywhere—
male or female, all seen within the Five-Colored Light,
as though gathered in one place.
Wherever they appeared,
the young and old, male and female, all prostrated in homage.

*The Celestial Worthies, according to each land,
expounded the Ten Marvelous Sutras,
instructed in prohibitions,
and declared distinctions between male and female.*

*At that time, the young and old from the four borders,
without exception, offered gold and silver,
five-colored patterned silks, jewels, and treasures—
countless beyond measure—to present to the Celestial Worthies,
receiving the precepts and venerating the sutras.*

*For seven days and seven nights,
the light shone brightly, dispelling darkness,
and the four directions returned to normal.
The treasures of faith filled the land,
and the Celestial Worthies at once distributed to the destitute—
the hungry were filled, the poor lacked nothing,
rich and poor became equal,
and no one harbored resentment.
The Celestial Records noted those with prior merit,
inscribing their names on golden tablets,
granting them world-transcendence,
flight through the void,
entrance into the Dao-gate,
and longevity of thirty-six thousand years.*

*Further, consulting the *Supreme Scripture of the Ultimate Peak’s Most Victorious and Unequaled Dao Collection*, it says:
The Primordial Celestial Worthies remained motionless for three days and three nights,
their faculties silent, entering profound stillness,
gazing into the wondrous gate.
All the great assembly likewise stood upright,
gazing upon the Lord’s countenance,
not a single misstep.

*After three days, the Primordial Celestial Worthies raised their body in smile,
their entire form radiating golden light,
illuminating the assembly in pure gold,
and emitted a subtle voice in praise of the Dao Lord:*
*"Excellent! Excellent!
My true child,
able to inherit the honored position,
teaching and transforming sentient beings,
opening the gate of expedient means—
just as I."*

chunks.original_text: 十方天尊，皆悉随喜。 元始天尊化作百亿黄金之殿，高下庄严，法坐绮饰，齐等如前，十方国土，皆在殿内。 分身天尊、十方界，见此光明，一时来集，相貌徒众，说法轨仪，称叹道君。 化身天尊者，《定志经》曰：时有十二年少，处世间乐，日日相就，共作饮食，嬉戏游观，或复议论为道之难易。 天尊以道眼遥见人前生在世得为人而秘吝经典，故弟子相道之心亦复犹预，因此彻缘，缘犹可度。 於是天尊即化作凡夫从会中过讦乞食，因共语化人曰：持戒甚易，违此难耳。 诸人闻化人言，皆各佥然。 问化人曰：云何先生持戒云易，不持极难。 化人曰：立身如戒，不畏天子，不畏鬼神，何为不易？ 如违戒者，是人悉畏，复畏鬼神，云何不难？ 於是十二年少，并有道意，因各各自忖，了达法缘。 《太上决疑经》云：元始天尊语徐来勒曰：吾以道眼遥於寂地，观察众生，有能分别，赐子法印，依教行者，我即化身种种，示现人天六道，随宜施作，倏有欻无，权示接引，覆护辅持。 今无留难，卿当以此正法之印，普教天人，咸使知识，按法奉行。 太极真人稽首奉命。 唐天皇问曰：道法在此，天中为极，为当更有所在？ 潘尊师答曰：谨按《登真隐诀》、《真灵位业经》云： 玉清紫虚高上元皇道君， 洞虚三元太明上皇道君， 虚明紫兰中元高上嵉皇道君， 太素高虚上极紫皇道君。 右玉清上元景四道君。 北玄高上虚皇道君， 南朱高上虚皇道君， 西华高上虚皇道君， 东明高上虚皇道君， 中元上合虚皇道君， 五灵七明混生高上道君。 右玉清中元紫清六道君。 三元无上玄老灵皇元晨君， 三元四极上元虚皇元灵君， 三元晨中黄景虚皇元台君， 三元紫映辉神虚生真元胎君， 玉玄皇道君， 上皇道君。 右玉清下元高清六元君。 高上道君， 玉皇道君， 玉玄道君， 玄清玉皇， 上皇天帝， 太上虚皇道君， 上皇高真太上王君， 三天太一元君。 右玉清诸道君，出《上清经》，并业崇重，但心相入寂，不复应化於下界也。 上清高圣太上玉晨玄皇大道君。 右太上大道君，为上清已下万道化主。 见《八素经》上。 紫微太素高虚洞曜三元道君， 紫晨微天帝道君， 紫明太山九道高元玉晨道君。 右上清道君主训教学真之人。 太虚飞晨中央黄老道君， 金阙帝晨后圣玄元上道君， 太元丹林太帝上道君， 后圣太师太微左真保皇道君， 上清紫清太素三元君道君， 上清上元太素元君道君， 上清中元紫素元君道君， 上清下元黄素元君道君， 上清紫晨天帝道君， 上清太微天高道君， 上清紫明太微九道高玄玉晨道君， 上清太虚上霄飞晨中央黄老道君， 上清紫元太微素三元道君， 玄清洞元青帝玉司道君， 玄清洞元赤帝玉司道君， 玄清洞元白帝玉司道君， 玄清洞元黑帝玉司道君， 玄清洞元黄帝玉司道君， 玄清紫元虚皇龟台九灵太真元君， 玄清太元东霞扶桑丹林太帝道君， 玄清太平金阙帝晨圣玄元上道君， 洞清九太虚后圣元影彭室上真道君， 洞清八景灵都玄老君道君， 洞清九微太真玉宝上相青童道君， 洞清太玄都九炁丈人主仙道君， 洞清玉真华先生国玉道君， 洞清玄洲二十九真伯上帝司禁道君， 洞清太元晨君列峨嵋洞宫玉道君， 洞清后圣九灵真子上道君， 洞清太平仙综司玉道君，

The Primordial Celestial Worthies manifested a palace of a hundred billion golden halls, resplendent in height and grandeur, adorned with lawful seats and ornate decorations, equal in splendor as before. All the ten-quadrant lands were contained within the palace.

The Manifested-Body Celestial Worthies of the ten-quadrant realms, upon seeing this radiance, gathered at once, their retinues assembled to expound the Dao’s rites and praise the Dao Lord.

The Manifested-Body Celestial Worthies—*as recorded in the Scripture of Fixed Resolution*—were once twelve young disciples dwelling in the world, indulging in worldly pleasures. Day by day, they gathered to share meals, engage in play and sightseeing, or debate the ease and difficulty of the Dao. The Celestial Worthies, perceiving through the Dao-Eye their past lives as humans who had hoarded scriptures in secret, saw their disciples’ hesitant hearts toward the Dao as well. Thus, they seized the opportunity to guide them, for even such hearts could be transformed.

Thereupon, the Celestial Worthies assumed the form of a common mortal passing through the assembly to beg for alms. Addressing the gathered disciples, the transformed figure said: *"To uphold the precepts is easy; to violate them is difficult."* The disciples, hearing these words, all fell silent in contemplation.

They asked the transformed figure: *"How is it that you say upholding the precepts is easy, while not upholding them is so difficult?"*

The transformed figure replied: *"To stand upright as the precepts demand—one need not fear kings nor ghosts and spirits. How is this not easy? But those who violate the precepts fear all men, and fear ghosts and spirits as well. How could this not be difficult?"*

chunks.original_text: 清微三天长生玄谷幽真道君， 清微安阳玄虚先生道君， 清微万石玄游先生道君， 清微上元三气度命道君， 清微南宫定仙司录道君， 清微安昌总仙度厄道君， 清微玄理炼魂上禁真皇道君， 清微生神化骨保仙道君， 清微玄虚万石先生道君， 太清紫元三气法师长生道君， 太清中宫青真小童道君。 《八素经》曰； 玉清宫之下真人乃上清宫之上真人，太清宫之上真人乃上清宫之下真人。 诸仙受行太上真道三品尽备者，为玉清道君真君。 诸仙受行上品经备者，为上清真人。 中品备及三品皆有而各不备者，并为中道真人。 下品备及中下皆有而不备者，并为下元真人。 诸仙受行中品经不备者，为太清真人。 诸仙受行下品经不备者，为九宫真人。 诸仙受行太极经者，为五岳名山地真人。 诸仙受行太清经者，为五岳名山地真人。 仙有九品，真有九品，圣有九品，合二十七品列之如左： 一至仙，　二灵仙，　三玄仙， 四飞仙，　五真仙，　六神仙， 七大仙，　八高仙，　九上仙。 真圣品一准至灵玄飞真人大高上而数。 右件真仙圣品位，足学地，从人学仙，仙学真，真学圣，圣学道，道学无极大道。 仙未及真，真未及圣，圣未及道，道未及无上正真无极大道。 唐天皇问曰：道家经皆是六十甲子灵官为首，起自星官？ 天师对曰：按《紫馆明真地仙洞诀经》曰：日月五星二十八宿，北斗九星，并有宫殿门户，其中有神灵帝皇后之列，尊卑阶级，总御风雨，统摄万灵，照煌照煌，并临下土。 一切众生名籍仰隶，人民善恶等业，众灵申奏上曹，善功者升名黄箓，罪责者书之黑簿。 功满三千，迁名仙格。 初学之人，修善立功，皆因阴阳六甲之正神，蒙削除罪录，纪名仙籍。 为此灵官，并是有为曹部，不能小有差违，若被遗志，则致年劫之晓，是故勤求启请，庶早成功。 此是学之初门，非大乘之高趣。 又初从凡学，犹为诸魔所障，是以上凭日月星官，下取六甲正气，将以摄御鬼神，辟除妖魔筌蹄。 初学极果不然，受法门徒各依阶级，从渐入顿，自下之高，故三乘教法，小大不等。 谨按《太真科》曰：盟威为下科，太清为中科，上清道德为上科，三科为三乘。 下机之人，先求自利，未能度人，故三皇、洞神陶炼智慧，自近之远，以明身为万善之本，济己可以及物。 中机之人，智慧明了，济物为利己之由，济身为度人之本，故中品洞玄，辩有通无，物我兼济。 若到洞真，混合真假，物我两遗，空有一贯。 是以中下之人，初始学道，立功树德，皆凭阴阳、六甲、日月五星。 一拟度身，二拟济物，或救疾疗病，拔死度生。 虽是有为功德，福力大多从此熏修，渐渐增进，功成不处，行满不居，常行阴惠，为而不恃，自与道合，终会无为。 唐天皇问曰：道法在此天中为极，唯当更有所在？ 尊师对曰：谨按《灵宝本元经》及《太真科》、《诸天灵书度命经》并曰：三界三清，四种大罗之别。 其三界合有二十八天，次上有四种人天，次上有无上三天，次上有一大罗高盖天。 太黄皇曾天，太明玉完天，清明何童天，玄胎平育天，元明文举天，七耀摩夷天。 右六天欲界，阴阳胎生，年积万岁。 虚无越衡天，太极蒙翳天，赤明和阳天，玄明恭华天，曜明宗飘天，竺落皇笳天，虚明堂耀天，观明端靖天，玄明恭庆天，太焕极瑶天，元载孔升天，太安皇崖天，显定极风天，始皇孝芒天，太皇访重天，无思江由天，上揲阮乐天，无极昙誓天。

*The Bā Sù Jīng* states:
*"The True Persons beneath the Yùqīng Palace are the Upper Qīng Palace’s Upper True Persons,
The True Persons above the Tàiqīng Palace are the Upper Qīng Palace’s Lower True Persons.
Those who have fully received and practiced the Three Grades of the Supreme True Dao are the Yùqīng Dao Lords, True Lords.
Those who have received and practiced the Upper Grade Scriptures are Upper Qīng True Persons.
Those who have received the Middle Grade and either the Upper or Lower Grades, but not fully, are Middle Dao True Persons.
Those who have received the Lower Grade and either the Middle or Lower Grades, but not fully, are Lower Yuan True Persons.
Those who have received the Middle Grade Scriptures but not fully are Tàiqīng True Persons.
Those who have received the Lower Grade Scriptures but not fully are Jiǔgōng True Persons.
Those who have received the Tàijí Scriptures are the Five Sacred Peaks and Named Mountains’ Earthly True Persons.
Those who have received the Tàiqīng Scriptures are the Five Sacred Peaks and Named Mountains’ Earthly True Persons.

There are nine ranks of *xiān* (immortals), nine ranks of *zhēn* (true persons), and nine ranks of *shèng* (sages), totaling twenty-seven ranks, arranged as follows:
1. *Yīzhì Xiān* (First Rank Immortal),
2. *Èrlíng Xiān* (Second Rank Spirit Immortal),
3. *Sān Xuān Xiān* (Third Rank Mysterious Immortal),
4. *Sì Fēi Xiān* (Fourth Rank Flying Immortal),
5. *Wǔ Zhēn Xiān* (Fifth Rank True Immortal),
6. *Liù Shén Xiān* (Sixth Rank Spirit Immortal),
7. *Qī Dà Xiān* (Seventh Rank Great Immortal),
8. *Bā Gāo Xiān* (Eighth Rank High Immortal),
9. *Jiǔ Shàng Xiān* (Ninth Rank Supreme Immortal.

The ranks of *zhēn* and *shèng* follow the same numbering as the *Dà Gāoshàng* ranks of *Xiān, Líng, Xuān, Fēi, Zhēn* in ascending order.

These ranks suffice for learning from the earth, progressing from humanity to immortality, from immortality to truth, from truth to sainthood, from sainthood to the Dao, and from the Dao to the Supreme Non-Extreme Great Dao.
An immortal who has not yet attained truth, a true person who has not yet attained sainthood, a sage who has not yet attained the Dao, and a Dao practitioner who has not yet attained the Supreme Non-Extreme Great Dao.

The Tang Heavenly Sovereign asked: *"The Daoist scriptures all begin with the Sixty Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches as the leading spirit officials—do they originate from the star officials?"*

The Master replied: *"According to the *Zǐguàn Míngzhēn Dìxiān Dòngjué Jīng*, it states:
The sun, moon, five planets, and Twenty-Eight Constellations, along with the Nine Stars of the Northern Dipper, all possess palaces, gates, and doors. Within them are ranked gods, spirits, emperors, and empresses, with distinctions of high and low. They govern the winds and rains, oversee all spirits, and shine resplendently, overseeing the mortal realm below. All beings’ names and records are registered beneath them. The people’s virtues and vices are recorded in their deeds, and the spirits report them to the celestial bureaucracy. Those with meritorious deeds are inscribed in the Yellow Registers, while those with offenses are recorded in the Black Ledgers. When their merits reach three thousand, their names are transferred to the immortal register.

Novices who practice virtue and establish merit rely on the righteous spirits of the six *jiǎ* (Heavenly Stems) and *zǐ* (Earthly Branches), have their sins erased, and are enrolled in the immortal ledgers. These are the spirit officials—all belong to the *Yǒuwéi* (Manifested) bureaucracy. They cannot be slighted, for if neglected, one will suffer in the next life. Thus, one must earnestly seek and petition, striving for early success. This is the initial gate of learning, not the highest path of the Great Vehicle.

Moreover, those beginning from the mortal realm are still obstructed by demons. Therefore, they rely on the celestial officials of the sun, moon, and stars below, and the righteous *qi* of the six *jiǎ*, to subdue ghosts and spirits, dispel demons, and eliminate calamities. However, the ultimate fruit of initial practice is not as described. Disciples who receive the teachings follow the graded path—from gradual to sudden, from low to high. Thus, the Three Vehicles’ teachings differ in scale.

According to the *Tàizhēn Kē*:
The *Míngwēi* (Oath of Power) is the Lower Grade, *Tàiqīng* is the Middle Grade, and *Shàngqīng Dàodé* is the Upper Grade—the three grades are the Three Vehicles.

Those of low capacity first seek self-benefit but cannot yet save others. Thus, the Three Sovereigns and Cavernous Gods refine wisdom, progressing from near to far, clarifying that the body is the foundation of all virtues, and that self-salvation can extend to others.

Those of medium capacity have clear wisdom, understanding that benefiting others is the path to self-benefit, and that self-cultivation is the foundation for saving others. Thus, the Middle Grade Cavernous Mysteries distinguish between the manifested and the void, achieving mutual benefit for self and others.

When reaching *Dòngzhēn* (Penetrating Truth), the true and false merge, and self and other are transcended, leaving only the singular path.

Thus, those of middle and low capacity, at the start of their Daoist practice, establish merit and cultivate virtue through the *yīnyáng* (yin-yang), the six *jiǎ*, the sun, moon, and five stars. Some align with the body, others with benefiting beings—whether healing illnesses, curing diseases, rescuing the dying, or saving the living. Though these are acts of conditional merit, their blessings are vast, gradually increasing. When merit is complete, one does not dwell on it; when practice is fulfilled, one does not cling. One constantly performs hidden kindnesses, acting without expectation, aligning with the Dao, and ultimately attaining non-action.

The Tang Heavenly Sovereign asked: *"The Dao’s laws reach their peak in this heaven—is there yet another realm?"*

The Master replied: *"According to the *Língbǎo Běnyuán Jīng*, the *Tàizhēn Kē*, and the *Zhūtiān Língshū Dùmìng Jīng*, it states:
The Three Realms and Three Purity domains comprise four kinds of Great Luo (transcendents). Below are the Twenty-Eight Heavens of the Three Realms, followed by the four kinds of Human Heavens, then the Three Supreme Heavens, and finally the Great Luo High-Covered Heaven.

The six *Yù* (Desire) realms—*Tàihuáng Chéngtiān* (Great Yellow Sovereign Heaven), *Tàimíng Yùwán Tiān* (Great Bright Jade Complete Heaven), *Qīngmíng Hé Tóng Tiān* (Clear Bright Harmony Child Heaven), *Xuāntāi Píngyù Tiān* (Primordial Womb Nurturing Heaven), *Yuánmíng Wénjǔ Tiān* (Primordial Bright Literary Ascension Heaven), and *Qīyào Móyí Tiān* (Seven Radiant Mo-Yi Heaven)—are yin-yang generated, with lifespans of ten thousand years.

Above them are the six *Xūwú* (Emptiness) realms—*Xūwú Yuèhéng Tiān* (Void Beyond Measure Heaven), *Tàijí Méngyì Tiān* (Great Extremes Obscured Heaven), *Chìmíng Héyáng Tiān* (Scarlet Bright Harmony Yang Heaven), *Xuānmíng Gōnghuá Tiān* (Mysterious Bright Reverent Splendor Heaven), *Yàomíng Zōngpiāo Tiān* (Radiant Bright Sovereign Drifting Heaven), *Zhúlòu Huángjiào Tiān* (Jade Fall Royal Horn Heaven), *Xūmíng Tángyào Tiān* (Void Bright Hall Radiance Heaven), *Guānmíng Duànjìng Tiān* (Observant Bright Tranquil Heaven), *Xuānmíng Gōngqìng Tiān* (Mysterious Bright Reverent Celebration Heaven), *Tàihuàn Jíyáo Tiān* (Great Splendor Extreme Jade Heaven), *Yuánzǎi Kǒngshēng Tiān* (Primordial Loaded Hollow Ascension Heaven), *Tàiān Huángyá Tiān* (Great Peace Royal Cliff Heaven), *Xiǎndìng Jífēng Tiān* (Manifest Destiny Extreme Wind Heaven), *Shǐhuáng Xiàománg Tiān* (First Sovereign Filial Brightness Heaven), *Tàihuáng Fǎngzhòng Tiān* (Great Sovereign Visiting Heavy Heaven), *Wúsī Jiāngyóu Tiān* (Non-Thought Jiang-You Heaven), *Shàngzhì Ruànlè Tiān* (Uppermost Auspicious Music Heaven), and *Wújí Duànshì Tiān* (Non-Extreme Tranquil Vow Heaven."*

chunks.original_text: 右十八天色界，阴阳有色，与欲界同，不相交接，人皆化生，年积亿岁，不残不伤也。 皓庭霄度天，　渊通元洞天， 翰宠妙成天，　秀乐禁上天。 右四天无色界，阴阳有形，身长数百里，不以为累，能隐形入微，无复色欲，唯直相知，积年万劫，虽不事学而能行善，福报所果。 至於魔王，学未极亦游此天，不得越三界，未免洪灾。 大运交周，二十八天，一时混沌，犹如雾谷，其中学真堪为种人者，圣母迎之，登常融、玉隆、梵度、贾奕四天之上。 其学圣真仙在三界者，退还人道，经历三涂，能越进者，当依功转。 无上常融天，　玉隆腾胜天， 龙变梵度天，　太极平育贾奕天。 右四种人天，名四梵天，寿命无有大期，唯有念念变易，日就增明，不论寿尽而终越此天，已下及三界，寿命远近并於中，增修仁净，於习气都尽，即生其中。 道门经法相承次序卷中竟 道门经法相承次序卷下 三清境从下，第一大赤天，第二禹余天，第三清微天。 右已上名无上三天，皆是证果极地妙行真人分形应化，神通自在，湛然常住不坏之天，分即为九清，凝然谓之一炁。 一炁外称为大罗天，即是元始天尊不动之所。 《度人经》曰：三界之上，眇眇大罗，上无色根，云层峨峨，唯有元始浩劫之家，即之谓常，三元八节，十直庚申，诸是斋日，十方上圣，五亿诸天妙行真人，无鞅数众，并严天威法服，各从十千万人，驾虚乘龙，作天大乐，啸歌邕邕，十绝灵旛，飘流浮空而上，大会玄都。 玄都大罗之天，玉京山之上。 玄中大法师十号者，与以前十号别。 一号无名之君，二号无上玄老，三号太上老君，四号高上老子，五号天皇大帝，六号玄中法师，七号有古先生，八号金阙帝君，九号虚无真人，十号太上高皇。 右出《真传》。 一曰大道，二曰正真，三曰太上，四曰老君，五曰玄老，六曰天尊，七曰十圣，八曰真圣，九曰玉帝，十曰法王。 一乘：谨按《太真科经》云：三乘相通，用有前后，叹而骇之，名曰一乘道也。 一念：经云，心得定也。 二景：谓日月也。 二气：谓阴阳。 二真：左玄真人，右玄真人。 二仪：圆天方地。 二篇：经云，为说道德，列以二篇，谓道经上，德经下。 二智：经云，权实救黎蒙。 二官：谓上仙、上灵。 三天：一曰始气化为清微天，二曰玄气化为禹余天，三曰元气化为大赤天。 三士：上士得道，升为仙官； 中士得道，栖集昆仑； 下士得道，长生世间。 又三士：上士气腾，驾景乘虚； 中士隐化，坐在立亡； 下士灭度，转轮圣王。 三精：阳精为日，阴精为月，和精为星。 三华：玉清内左宫，玉清右宫，玉清中宫。 三箓：一金箓，上元主天，天者乾为天，金箓主之，故销天灾也。 二黄箓，下元主地，地者坤，坤包黄，故黄箓主之，济拔七祖，七祖恐在地府。 三玉箓，中元主人，人出箓者，资於德，玉备德，玉备德，故玉箓主王公。 三阶：有，有无，非有非无，此形之三阶。 有阴，有阳，有和，此气之三阶。 有智，有愚，有庸，此神识之三阶也。 有利，有钝，有平，此才用之三阶也。 凡十有五事，同宗一气也。 三世：过去无极，当来无极，见在无极。 三自然：利根之人，学大自然，守虚无，变化生死，为世世宗师。
chunks.translated_text:
「To the right, the eighteen heavens of the Color Realm, where *yīnyáng* (yin-yang) manifest as hues, sharing the same origin as the Desire Realm yet not intermingling with it. Here, all beings are born through transformation, their lifespans accumulating to a hundred million years, yet they suffer neither decay nor harm.

The Radiant Court of the Celestial Path Heaven, the Abyssal Communion of the Primordial Cavern Heaven, the Graceful Favor of the Wondrous Completion Heaven, and the Refined Music of the Forbidden Ascension Heaven—these four are the heavens of the Formless Realm. Within them, *yīnyáng* (yin-yang) takes shape, with bodies stretching hundreds of *lǐ* (leagues), yet they do not weary from it. They can vanish their forms into subtlety, free from all color and desire, knowing only the straight path. Their years span countless *jié* (kalpas), yet though they do not study, they naturally act with benevolence, reaping the fruits of their merit.

As for the demon kings, even those whose learning is not yet perfected wander here, yet they cannot surpass the Three Realms, nor escape the great calamity.

When the grand cycle turns, the twenty-eight heavens merge into one moment of chaos, like the mists of the *Gǔ* (Valley) of *Hóng* (Confusion). Among them, those who truly grasp the Dao are welcomed by the Holy Mother, ascending beyond the four heavens of *Chángróng* (Ever-Melting), *Yùlóng* (Jade-Surging), *Fàndù* (Dharma-Ascending), and *Jiǎyù* (Jade-Resounding).

Those who attain the Dao as Holy True Ones within the Three Realms are returned to the human path, enduring the Three Trials. Those who advance further do so according to their merit.

The Heaven of Supreme Ever-Melting, the Heaven of Jade-Surging Triumph, the Heaven of Dragon-Transformation Dharma-Ascending, and the Heaven of Great Dao Tranquil Jade-Resounding—these four are the heavens of the Human Realm, known as the Four Dharma-Heavens. Their lifespans know no fixed limit, for they shift moment by moment, growing ever brighter each day. They do not depart these heavens when their span ends, nor descend to the Three Realms; their distance is measured within the middle. Those who cultivate *rénjìng* (benevolent purity) until their *xíqì* (habitual tendencies) are exhausted are born there.

The Daoist scriptures, passed down in succession, conclude their first volume.

The Daoist scriptures, passed down in succession, begin their second volume.

The Three Pure Ones’ realm starts below: the First is the Great Red Heaven, the Second is the Yu-Remainder Heaven, and the Third is the Pure Mists Heaven.

The three heavens above are called the Supreme Three Heavens, where those who have realized the Dao and attained the ultimate mysteries manifest in wondrous forms. Their divine powers are boundless, dwelling eternally unbroken. These are the origins of the Nine Pure Ones, condensed into one *qì* (breath/essence).

Beyond this *qì* lies the Great Luo Heaven, the abode of the Primordial Origin Lord’s immovable essence. The *Sutra of Degrees* states: Above the Three Realms, the vast Great Luo, where no formless roots exist—its clouds rise in towering layers, and only the Primordial Origin’s boundless kalpas dwell there. This is called the Supreme. The three *yuán* (primordial cycles) and eight *jié* (nodes), the ten *zhí* (straight days) of *gēngshēn* (regeneration), and all such days of abstinence—when the ten thousand saints and five hundred million wondrous Daoist beings, countless as the stars, don their celestial law-garments, each leading ten million souls, ride upon the void, ascend with dragons, and perform the grand celestial music, singing with resounding voices, their ten thousand banners fluttering in unison—all drift through the empty sky and gather in the Mysterious Metropolis. The Mysterious Metropolis Great Luo Heaven lies above the Jade Capital Mountain.

The ten titles of the *Xuánzhōng* (Mysterious Metropolis) Grand Master differ from the previous ten titles:
1. The Nameless Lord,
2. The Supreme Mysterious Elder,
3. The Highest Elder Lord,
4. The Exalted Elder Sage,
5. The Heavenly Sovereign Great Emperor,
6. The Mysterious Metropolis Grand Master,
7. The Ancient Sage,
8. The Golden Gate Emperor Lord,
9. The Formless True Person,
10. The Highest Emperor of the Supreme.

9. The Jade Emperor,
10. The Law King.

The One Vehicle: According to *The Great True Science Sutra*, the Three Vehicles are interconnected, with varying applications. When one is astonished by their unity, it is called the One Vehicle Dao.

The One Mind: The scripture says, "The mind attains stillness."

The Two Scenes: Refers to the sun and moon.

The Two *Qi*: Refers to *yīnyáng* (yin-yang).

The Two True Ones: The Left Mysterious True Person, the Right Mysterious True Person.

The Two *Yí*: The round heaven and the square earth.

The Two Volumes: The scripture says, "For the sake of expounding the Dao and virtue, it is arranged in two volumes: the Dao Scripture above, the Virtue Scripture below."

The Two Wisdoms: The scripture says, "The provisional and the real, saving the ignorant and the enlightened."

The Two Officials: Refers to the Highest Celestial and the Highest Spirit.

The Three Heavens: 1. The Primordial *Qi* transforms into the Pure Mists Heaven, 2. The Mysterious *Qi* transforms into the Yu-Remainder Heaven, 3. The Original *Qi* transforms into the Great Red Heaven.

The Three Worthies: The superior worthy attains the Dao and ascends to become a celestial official; the middle worthy attains the Dao and dwells on Kunlun; the inferior worthy attains the Dao and lives long in the mortal world. Again, the Three Worthies: The superior worthy’s *qi* surges, riding the sun and moon upon the void; the middle worthy’s transformation is hidden, seated yet present, standing yet absent; the inferior worthy’s extinction is complete, becoming a Wheel-Turning Sage King.

The Three Essences: The yang essence is the sun, the yin essence is the moon, and the harmonious essence is the stars.

The Three Palaces: The Left Palace of the Jade Purity, the Right Palace of the Jade Purity, and the Central Palace of the Jade Purity.

The Three *Qì*: 1. The golden *qì*, which governs the upper primordial and the heavens—heaven being *qián* (the creative), so the golden *qì* rules it, thus dispelling celestial calamities. 2. The yellow *qì*, which governs the lower primordial and the earth—earth being *kūn* (the receptive), which contains the yellow, so the yellow *qì* rules it, thus rescuing the seven ancestors, who might otherwise fear the underworld. 3. The white *qì*, which governs the central primordial and humanity—those who receive the *qì* are endowed with virtue, and jade embodies virtue, hence the white *qì* rules kings and nobles.

The Three Stages: Having, having-not, neither having nor not—these are the three stages of form. Having yin, having yang, having harmony—these are the three stages of *qi*. Having wisdom, having foolishness, having mediocrity—these are the three stages of divine consciousness. Having sharpness, having dullness, having balance—these are the three stages of talent and application.

In all, fifteen matters, sharing the same origin and *qi*. The Three Worlds: The past without limit, the future without limit, the present without limit. The Three Naturals: Those with sharp roots study the great naturalness, guard the void, and master transformation and death, becoming the ancestors of all ages.»

chunks.original_text: 宗师者，圣人也。 平根之人，学中自然，守神炼形，飞为天官真人。 钝根之人，学小自然，守阴阳气，生毛羽，飞仙也。 三患：一嫉妬，二诽谤，三贪欲。 三丹田：眉间赤子神，心下真人神，脐下婴儿神。 三道：一圣道，二真道，三仙道。 又三道：一无极大道，二无上大道，三无为大道。 三元：上元八，中元八，下元八。 三魂：一名爽灵，二名胎光，三名幽精。 三毒：与前三毒别，一贪淫，二嗔恚，三愚痴。 三乘学行：小乘学洞神，得道成仙。 仙有九品：第一上仙男皇女后，二高仙男帝女后，三大仙男王女妃，四神仙男公女妃，五玄仙男卿女夫人，六真仙男大夫女夫人，七天仙男士女妻，八灵仙，九至仙男士女妻。 中乘学洞玄，得道成真。 真有九品：一上真，二高真，三大真，四神真，五妙真，六天真，七仙真，八灵真，九至真。 大乘学洞真，得道成真。 圣有九品：一上圣，二高圣，三大圣，四神圣，五玄圣，六仙圣，七真圣，八灵圣，九至圣。 三皇：天地人是三皇。 三象：玄气青，元气白，始气黄。 三愿：一愿天清，二愿地宁，三愿人生。 三真：第一郁罗翘，二光妙音，三真定光。 三一：真一，正一，太一。 三官亦谓三元：上元天官，治阳元之士； 中元地官，治酆都山洞中； 下元水官； 治九江洞室中。 三山：一阆风亦名蓬莱，三瀛洲，三方壶。 三灾：一大旱，二大病，三大水。 三尸：一上尸好宝货，二中尸好五味，三下尸好色欲，亦五色 三要：第一要当求生，二要当求藏形，三要当避世荣。 三吉凶：一生年月，二婚姻，三家宅。 三会：正月七日，七月七日，十月五日。 三恶：一生虫中，二生鸟中，三生兽中。 三劫：一龙汉前劫，二赤明中劫，三开皇今劫。 四辇：一男，道士二男，俗人三女，女官四女。 俗人 三等：一贵人，二士人，三庶人。 四达：一达过去无穷之事，二达见在一切之事，三达未来无量之事，四达无边圣众境界之事。 四辩：一法辩，能夷就诸法； 二义辩，通达诸义； 三心辩，乐为众说； 四巧辩，言利无有遗滞。 四施：一救贫病，二立观宇，三造经法，四建斋讲。 四等：以前己有，某一唯慈，某二唯爱，某三唯善，某四唯忍。 五老：一白元，二无英，三桃君，四司命，五太一。 主符籍 五通：眼通，耳通，鼻通，舌通，心通。 五持戒：一行仁，慈爱不杀，拯生度死，目能久视，目通肝，肝藏魂，肝魂相安。 东方木二行义，赏善罚恶，不盗，耳了玄音，耳通肺，肺藏魄，肺魄相洽。 西方金三行礼，敬老慈少，不淫，口盈法露，心神相和。 南方火四行智，化愚学圣，断酒损欲，肾精相合。 北方水五行信，守中不坏疑，始终无忘，脾志相成。 中央土，出《老子经戒》。 五难：一贫穷布施难，二豪贵学道难，三制命不死难，四得见洞经难，五生遇圣道难。 五逆：一怨天地，二秽辱日月星辰，三呵风骂雨，四为臣不忠，五为子不孝顺。 五道：一天道，二人道，三地狱道，四饿鬼道，五畜生道。 五魔：青天魔王巴元丑伯，赤天魔王负天担石，白天魔王反山六目，黑天魔王监丑朗馥，黄天魔王横天担力。 五帝：一青帝灵威仰，二赤帝赤熛弩，三黄帝含枢纽，四白帝曜魄宝，五黑帝隐候局。
chunks.translated_text:
The **宗师** is the **Saint**.

The **平根** (mediocre-rooted) person studies the **Middle Naturalness**, guards the spirit and refines the form, and ascends as the **Celestial Official True Person**.

The **钝根** (dull-rooted) person studies the **Lesser Naturalness**, guards the yin-yang *qi*, grows feathers, and becomes a **Flying Immortal**.

The **Three Afflictions**: envy, slander, and greed.

The **Three Dantians**: the **赤子神** (Infant Spirit) at the brow, the **真人神** (True Person Spirit) at the heart, and the **婴儿神** (Infant Spirit) at the navel.

The **Three Dao**: the **Saintly Dao**, the **True Dao**, and the **Immortal Dao**.
Again, the **Three Dao**: the **Great Dao of the Limitless**, the **Great Dao of the Supreme**, and the **Great Dao of Non-Action**.

The **Three Elements**: the **Upper Element** (eight days), the **Middle Element** (eight days), the **Lower Element** (eight days).

The **Three Souls**: the **爽灵** (Luminous Soul), the **胎光** (Fetal Light), and the **幽精** (Mysterious Essence).

The **Three Poisons** (distinct from the prior three): lust, wrath, and delusion.

The **Three Vehicles of Learning and Practice**:
- The **Lesser Vehicle** studies the **Cavern Spirit**, attains the Dao, and becomes an **Immortal**.
  The **Nine Ranks of Immortals**:
  1. **Upper Immortal** (male: **皇**, female: **后**)
  2. **High Immortal** (male: **帝**, female: **后**)
  3. **Great Immortal** (male: **王**, female: **妃**)
  4. **Divine Immortal** (male: **公**, female: **妃**)
  5. **Mysterious Immortal** (male: **卿**, female: **夫人**)
  6. **True Immortal** (male: **大夫**, female: **夫人**)
  7. **Celestial Immortal** (male: **士**, female: **妻**)
  8. **Spiritual Immortal**
  9. **Ultimate Immortal** (male: **士**, female: **妻**)

- The **Middle Vehicle** studies the **Cavern of the Mysterious**, attains the Dao, and becomes a **True One**.
  The **Nine Ranks of True Ones**:
  1. **Upper True One**
  2. **High True One**
  3. **Great True One**
  4. **Divine True One**
  5. **Wondrous True One**
  6. **Celestial True One**
  7. **Immortal True One**
  8. **Spiritual True One**
  9. **Ultimate True One**

- The **Great Vehicle** studies the **Cavern of the True**, attains the Dao, and becomes a **Saint**.
  The **Nine Ranks of Saints**:
  1. **Upper Saint**
  2. **High Saint**
  3. **Great Saint**
  4. **Divine Saint**
  5. **Mysterious Saint**
  6. **Immortal Saint**
  7. **True Saint**
  8. **Spiritual Saint**
  9. **Ultimate Saint**

The **Three Sovereigns**: Heaven, Earth, and Man.

The **Three Symbols**: **玄气** (Mysterious *Qi*) is green, **元气** (Primordial *Qi*) is white, **始气** (Original *Qi*) is yellow.

The **Three Vows**:
  1. May Heaven be clear,
  2. May Earth be tranquil,
  3. May life flourish.

The **Three True Ones**:
  1. **郁罗翘** (Yùluó Qiáo),
  2. **光妙音** (Guāng Miào Yīn),
  3. **真定光** (Zhēn Dìng Guāng).

The **Three Ones**: **True One**, **Rectified One**, **Great One**.

The **Three Officials** (also called the **Three Elements**):
- **Upper Element (天官)**, governing those of the **Yang Element**,
- **Middle Element (地官)**, governing the **Across-the-River Mountains and Caverns**,
- **Lower Element (水官)**, governing the **Nine Rivers and Caverns**.

The **Three Mountains**:
  1. **阆风** (Làngfēng, also called **蓬莱**),
  2. **三瀛洲** (Three Penglai Isles),
  3. **三方壶** (Three Cauldrons).

The **Three Calamities**: great drought, great sickness, and great flood.

The **Three Corpses**:
  1. The **Upper Corpse** loves treasures,
  2. The **Middle Corpse** loves flavors,
  3. The **Lower Corpse** loves lust (and the five colors).

The **Three Essentials**:
  1. First, seek life,
  2. Second, seek to conceal the form,
  3. Third, avoid worldly honor.

The **Three Matters of Fortune and Misfortune**: birth year and month, marriage, and home.

The **Three Gatherings**: the 7th day of the 1st month, the 7th day of the 7th month, and the 5th day of the 10th month.

The **Three Evils**: rebirth as an insect, a bird, or a beast.

The **Three Eons**:
  1. The **Dragon-Han Eon** (before),
  2. The **赤明 Middle Eon**,
  3. The **Kaihuang Present Eon**.

The **Four Palanquins**:
  1. One male,
  2. Two Daoist males,
  3. Three common females,
  4. Four female officials.

The **Three Commoners**:
  1. **Noble**,
  2. **Scholar**,
  3. **Commoner**.

The **Four Penetrations**:
  1. Penetration of limitless past matters,
  2. Penetration of all present matters,
  3. Penetration of limitless future matters,
  4. Penetration of the boundless realm of the **Saints**.

The **Four Eloquences**:
  1. **Law Eloquence**, able to harmonize all matters,
  2. **Doctrine Eloquence**, able to penetrate all meanings,
  3. **Heart Eloquence**, delighting in teaching the masses,
  4. **Skillful Eloquence**, speaking with no omission.

The **Four Acts of Charity**:
  1. Rescue the poor and sick,
  2. Establish halls and temples,
  3. Copy and propagate scriptures,
  4. Hold fasting lectures.

The **Four Categories** (of virtue):
  1. **Certain One** (only compassion),
  2. **Certain Two** (only love),
  3. **Certain Three** (only goodness),
  4. **Certain Four** (only forbearance).

The **Five Elders**:
  1. **白元** (Bái Yuán),
  2. **无英** (Wú Yīng),
  3. **桃君** (Táo Jūn),
  4. **司命** (Sī Mìng),
  5. **太一** (Tài Yī).

The **Five Talismans** and **Five Penetrations**:
  - **Eye Penetration**,
  - **Ear Penetration**,
  - **Nose Penetration**,
  - **Tongue Penetration**,
  - **Mind Penetration**.

The **Five Precepts**:
  1. **East (Wood) – Two Practices of Righteousness**:
     - Reward the good, punish the evil, do not steal.
     - Ears hear the **Mysterious Sound**, ears penetrate the **liver**, the liver houses the **hun**, and the liver and *hun* are in harmony.
  2. **South (Fire) – Four Practices of Wisdom**:
     - Transform the foolish, learn from the Sage, abstain from alcohol, reduce desire.
     - The **kidneys** preserve the **jing**, and the kidneys and *jing* are unified.
  3. **West (Metal) – Three Practices of Ceremony**:
     - Respect the elderly, love the young, do not indulge in lust.
     - The mouth is filled with **Dharma Dew**, and the heart and spirit are in harmony.
  4. **North (Water) – Five Practices of Faithfulness**:
     - Guard the center, do not doubt, remain steadfast from beginning to end.
     - The **spleen** and **will** are harmonized.
  5. **Central (Earth)** – Follows the *Laozi Jing Stele*.

The **Five Difficulties**:
  1. Difficulty in almsgiving while poor,
  2. Difficulty in learning the Dao while noble,
  3. Difficulty in escaping fate,
  4. Difficulty in obtaining the **Cavern Scriptures**,
  5. Difficulty in encountering the **Saintly Dao**.

The **Five Treasons**:
  1. Blaming Heaven and Earth,
  2. Defiling or insulting the sun, moon, and stars,
  3. Reviling the wind and cursing the rain,
  4. As a subject, being disloyal,
  5. As a child, being unfilial.

The **Five Paths**:
  1. **Heavenly Path**,
  2. **Human Path**,
  3. **Hell Path**,
  4. **Hungry Ghost Path**,
  5. **Animal Path**.

The **Five Demons**:
  1. **青天魔王** (Qīngtiān Mówáng) **巴元丑伯** (Bā Yuán Chǒu Bó),
  2. **赤天魔王** (Chìtiān Mówáng) **负天担石** (Fùtiān Dànshí),
  3. **白天魔王** (Báitiān Mówáng) **反山六目** (Fǎnshān Liù Mù),
  4. **黑天魔王** (Hēitiān Mówáng) **监丑朗馥** (Jiān Chǒu Lǎng Fú),
  5. **黄天魔王** (Huángtiān Mówáng) **横天担力** (Héngtiān Dàn Lì).

The **Five Emperors**:
  1. **青帝** (Qīngdì) **灵威仰** (Língwēi Yǎng),
  2. **赤帝** (Chìdì) **赤熛弩** (Chì Chì Nǔ),
  3. **黄帝** (Huángdì) **含枢纽** (Hán Shū Niǔ),
  4. **白帝** (Báidì) **曜魄宝** (Yào Pò Bǎo),
  5. **黑帝** (Hēidì) **隐候局** (Yǐn Hòu Jú).

chunks.original_text: 五食：中食，过中不味； 蔬食，唯菜而已； 粗食，麦苣蕂； 药食，服食众药； 气食，服气咽液。 五浊：一见浊，邪见。 二劫浊，日月短促。 三众生浊，精神不明。 四烦 恼浊，嗔恚斗诤。 五命浊，短寿。 五行：一血，属水。 二骨，属木。 三肉，属土。 四齿爪，属金。 五气暖，属火。 五荫：一色荫，眼见一切色。 二受荫，以觉是非。 三想荫，心思惟之。 四行荫，心随想行事。 五识荫，心知生灭，识想鉴记。 五真：一天师张道陵，二徐来勒，三真定光，四郁罗翘，五光妙音。 断五根：灭餐不思滋味，灭香不思芳美，灭衣勿贪细滑，灭色目不看玄黄，灭声耳不听丝竹。 五欲：一眼欲五色，二耳欲五声，三鼻欲五气，四舌欲五味，五身欲五触。 六觉：眼觉色，耳觉声，鼻觉香，身觉触，舌觉味，心觉想，心一切觉。 六通：一目通，能彻视洞达，坐见十方天上地下，无有障蔽，六合内外，鬼神人物，幽显大小，莫不了然，分明如视掌中。 二耳通，能洞听天上天下，四面八方，一切音声，无不悉闻，人天禽兽，蝖飞蠢动，一切众声闻悉，晓了分明。 三鼻通，晓百和宝香，分辨气数，浓薄差失，纤毫必记，四方上下，异域绝境，香臭之气，闻如面前。 四舌通，万品众物，合为一食，经舌悉知种类，分别其味。 五身通，能飞行上下，履火涉水，经山触石，无所慑碍，分形散体，千变万化形，长充於八极，短入於毫微。 六心通，回一切法，皆悉空净。 六行：孝、慈、爱、贞、忠、谦。 六空：道至空，随事空，非不空，非是空，非非空，非非不空。 六洞：天为洞视，地为洞听，东为洞空，西为洞虚，南为洞清，北为洞微。 六善：三明，四达，五定，六通，三十二相，八十一好。 知青赤。 三肺，主知角征。 四肾，主知膻焦香腥朽。 五脾，主知酸苦。 六胆，主知柔弱，操总知滑、刚强、温润。 亦为六尘。 六家：一甲寅，木神主骸骨。 二甲辰，风神主气息。 三甲午，火神主温暖。 四甲申，金神主牙齿。 五甲戌，土神主肌肉。 六甲子，水神主血液。 六天：一赤虚天，二玄都天，三清浩天，四泰玄都天，五泰苍天，六泰清天。 七魄：一名尸狗，二名伏矢，三名雀阴，四名吞贱，五名非毒，六名除秽，七名臭拂。 七部经：正一部三卷，太平部四卷，太清部三十六卷，洞玄部五十一卷，洞真部一百五十一卷，太玄部一百三十五卷，洞神部。 七觉：北斗七星是也。 七曜：日，月，东大明，南荧惑，西太白，北辰，中央镇星。 八难：一生得免三恶道为人难。 二得为人，去女为男难。 三既得为男，六根具足难。 四六根既具足，得生中国难。 五生中国，遇值有道国君难。 六值有道师尊难。 七善心既发，寻得道长生难。 八既信道德，值三光齐朗，三宝不绝难。 八节斋：立春，春分，立夏，夏至，立秋，秋分，立冬，冬至，此日各有直官。 阳九之厄，百六之会：四千五百岁为一元，一元之中九厄，阳五阴四。 阳为火旱，阴为水涝。 太极九名亦名仙府九宫，一太清，二太极，三太微，四紫房，五玄台，六帝堂，七天府，八皇宫，九天原。 其域同一。 四等因：一者因善知识而得悟理，二者因至心听而得悟理，三者因念念思惟而得悟理，四者因如法修行而得悟理。

The **Five Emperors**:
  1. **青帝** (Qīngdì) **灵威仰** (Língwēi Yǎng),
  2. **赤帝** (Chìdì) **赤熛弩** (Chì Chì Nǔ),
  3. **黄帝** (Huángdì) **含枢纽** (Hán Shū Niǔ),
  4. **白帝** (Báidì) **曜魄宝** (Yào Pò Bǎo),
  5. **黑帝** (Hēidì) **隐候局** (Yǐn Hòu Jú).

chunks.original_text: 四威仪：一行，二住，三坐，四卧。 念念不灭，是四功德。 四无：一者未出未生名之为无，如树藏芽未造木种。 二者已灭已绝名之为无，如一切物等破坏磨灭。 三者失对无四，不可独有，名之为无，如失假偶。 四者如不有物，毕竟空无，如龟毛兔角。 四有：一者已生已出名之为有，如子孙万物等是有。 二者植诸果实，存种生苗，如子实相续是有。 三者如经中六句三等义，二并俱有，示不可无。 四者如虚凝，常道清净，湛然一相，无为是有，真慧得知过去未来见在，若圣若凡，若因若果，天地劫数，成坏净秽，了了悉知，谓之慧得。 三自然：前已有不同。 一体自然，虚凝真常是。 二应自然，和气升降是。 三受自然，青黄赤白黑是。 二十八宿：东方角亢氏房心尾箕，南方井鬼柳星张翼轸，西方奎娄胃 昴毕觜参，北方斗牛女虚危室壁。 五星：东方岁星，南方荧惑，西方太白，北方辰星，中央镇星。 六斋月：正月，三月，五月，七月，九月，十一月。 上三天令天帝太一日月星宿，三官考召司察天下罪过，以上白三天考召之，若能修此岁中六斋之法，令除十苦八难，得免厄伐，拜谒太上，三尸去可得长生不老。 天师教诸男女官为道，当修月中，十直月一日，北斗下八日，北斗司命杀鬼下十四日，太一使者下十五日，天帝下十八日，天一下二十三日，太一八神使者下二十四日，北辰下二十八日，下太一下二十九日，中太一下月三十日，上太一自下十五日。 天帝下者，日月星宿其中，诸官森然，俱下三十日。 上太一自下者，日月五星，二十八宿，璇玑玉衡，七星北斗，司命司录，司杀司罚，大圣尊神，妙行真人，天帝真王其中，诸天及鬼神，森然俱下。 当此之日，天神地祇莫不倾悚周行天下，伺人善恶。 其日若有执心精进，不违经教，弘宣道法，益人寿算，度录左契，文免患难，名上三天，克名玉录，拜为真人。 八节日仙官会：已前有不同。 立春日，太极真人会诸仙真，刻玉简，记仙名。 春分日，太素真人会诸仙官，於昆仑瑶台校定真经。 立夏日，五帝会诸神仙於紫微宫，见四真人，论求道者之功罪。 夏至之日，天上三官会於司何侯，校定万人罪福，增年减算。 立秋之日，五岳真人会谒黄老君於黄房云庭之山，集仙官，定神图灵药。 秋分之日，上皇太帝君登上清，集众真万仙会于寥阳之殿，共议定天下万人罪福，记学道求仙之懃懈，疏犯过日月修行善恶刑罚之科，根源修例，副之司命，书于黄箓。 立冬之日，阳台真人会诸仙人，定新得道，始入名仙录。 冬至之日，众仙诣方诸东海青童君，刻定众仙籍，金书内字，甲子日支干端数，六旬归宗，天人合纪，四时加庆。 庚申之日，金威肃杀，岱府秉刑，魄精紏过，尸鬼奏恶，生由此源，应当检遏邪津，开显正道。 月建之日，阴阳改度，百神受事，建德惟新，并解除先谴，进修后善。 月晦之日，阴精毁损，躔次数周，幽府搜简，司官定律。 月望之日，圆魄充满，阳光合映，照拂冥愆，散荡幽咎，察往照来，机动必接。 甲寅日，并是魂魄躁竞之辰。 十直之日，诸天上帝，妙行真人，并诣玄都玉京，朝谒虚皇大道君，简校人鬼生死罪录，善恶殊分。 五物：亦谓五行，一血，天水二骨天木三肉，天土四齿，天金五气。

「The Four Sacred Etiquettes (四威仪):
  1. **Conduct** (行),
  2. **Abiding** (住),
  3. **Sitting** (坐),
  4. **Lying Down** (卧).
  To remain ever-mindful without extinction is the **Fourfold Merit of Virtue/Power** (是四功德).

**The Fourfold "Non-Existence" (四无):
  1. That which has yet to emerge or be born is called **"Non-Existence"** (无), as with a tree whose buds remain concealed and have not yet formed seeds.
  2. That which has already perished or ceased is called **"Non-Existence"** (无), as with all things once destroyed or worn away.
  3. That which lacks a counterpart—**Non-Existence** (无) cannot exist alone—is called **"Non-Existence"** (无), as with lost illusory pairs.
  4. That which is utterly devoid of substance, fundamentally empty and non-existent, is called **"Non-Existence"** (无), such as tortoise hair or rabbit horns.

**The Fourfold "Existence" (四有):
  1. That which has already emerged or been born is called **"Existence"** (有), as with descendants and all ten thousand things.
  2. That which bears fruit, preserves seeds, and nurtures sprouts is called **"Existence"** (有), as with offspring continuing generation after generation.
  3. As in the **Sutra’s** six phrases of threefold meaning (六句三等义), where two coexist simultaneously, demonstrating that **"Existence"** (有) cannot be absent.
  4. Like **emptiness congealing** (虚凝)—the **Dao/Way** ever pure and serene, its singular essence manifest—**"Non-Existence"** (无) is **"Existence"** (有), for **true wisdom** (真慧) reveals past, present, and future, whether **saints** (若圣) or **common folk** (若凡), **causes** (若因) or **effects** (若果), the cycles of **heavens and earth**, the rise and fall of **kalpas**, the purity and defilement of all phenomena—knowing them all clearly, this is called **"Wisdom’s Attainment"** (谓之慧得).

**The Threefold Naturals (三自然):
  Their distinctions were previously mentioned.
  1. **Natural Unity** (一体自然)—**emptiness congealing** (虚凝) and **true constancy** (真常).
  2. **Natural Response** (应自然)—the **harmonious movement of *qi*** (和气升降).
  3. **Natural Reception** (受自然)—the **Five Phases** (青黄赤白黑).

**The Twenty-Eight Constellations (二十八宿):
  - East: **Jiao (角)**, **Xing (亢)**, **Fang (房)**, **Xin (心)**, **Wei (尾)**, **Ji (箕)**.
  - South: **Jing (井)**, **Gui (鬼)**, **Liu (柳)**, **Xing (星)**, **Zhang (张)**, **Yi (翼)**, **Zhen (轸)**.
  - West: **Kui (奎)**, **Luo (娄)**, **Wei (胃)**, **Mao (昴)**, **Bi (毕)**, **Zui (觜)**, **Shen (参)**.
  - North: **Dou (斗)**, **Niu (牛)**, **Nü (女)**, **Xu (虚)**, **Wei (危)**, **Shi (室)**, **Bi (壁)**.

**The Five Stars (五星):
  - East: **Sui Star** (岁星, *Jupiter*).
  - South: **Yinghuo Star** (荧惑, *Mars*).
  - West: **Tai Bai Star** (太白, *Venus*).
  - North: **Chen Star** (辰星, *Saturn*).
  - Central: **Zhen Star** (镇星, *Polaris*).

**The Six Months of Abstinence (六斋月):**
  The **first**, **third**, **fifth**, **seventh**, **ninth**, and **eleventh** months.
  The **Three Celestial Orders** (三官) and the **Celestial Sovereign** (天帝) of the **Upper Three Heavens** (上三天) oversee and inspect the sins of mortals throughout the year. The **Celestial Sovereign** (天帝) of the **Upper Three Heavens** (上三天) presides over this judgment. If one practices the **Six Monthly Abstinence Rituals** (岁中六斋之法) faithfully, they may be freed from the **Ten Sufferings and Eight Hardships** (十苦八难), avoid calamity and punishment (免厄伐), and be granted an audience with the **Supreme One** (太上), allowing the **Three Corpses** (三尸) to depart and achieve **immortality** (长生不老).

**The Heavenly Master’s Teaching on the Rituals for Officials and Laypeople (天师教诸男女官为道):**
  During the **Six Months of Abstinence** (斋月), the **Ten Pure Months** (十直月) begin on the **first day**, the **Eight Days of the Northern Dipper** (北斗下八日) follow, then the **Ten Days of the Northern Dipper’s Officer of Life and Death** (北斗司命杀鬼下十四日), the **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity’s Messenger** (太一使者下十五日), the **Eighteen Days of the Celestial Sovereign** (天帝下十八日), the **Twenty-Three Days of the Uppermost Heaven** (天一下二十三日), the **Twenty-Four Days of the Eight Deities of Heavenly Unity** (太一八神使者下二十四日), the **Twenty-Eight Days of the Northern Pole** (北辰下二十八日), the **Twenty-Nine Days of the Uppermost Heaven** (下太一下二十九日), and the **Thirty Days of the Central Heaven** (中太一下月三十日). The **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity** (上太一自下十五日) conclude the cycle.

  On the **Eighteen Days of the Celestial Sovereign** (天帝下者), the **day, moon, stars, and constellations** (日月星宿) are within its purview, and all officials (诸官) descend together for the **thirty days**.

  On the **Fifteen Days of the Heavenly Unity** (上太一自下者), the **day, moon, Five Stars, Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Azure Gem and Jade Balance** (璇玑玉衡), the **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper** (七星北斗), the **Officers of Life and Death** (司命司录), the **Officers of Punishment and Retribution** (司杀司罚), the **Great Saints and Venerable Deities** (大圣尊神), the **Mystic Conduct True Persons** (妙行真人), and the **Celestial Sovereign’s True King** (天帝真王) are within its purview, and all **heavens and spirits** (诸天及鬼神), officials (仙官) descend together for the **thirty days**.

  On these days, **celestial spirits and earthly deities** (天神地祇) alike tremble and circulate throughout the world, observing human **virtue and vice** (善恶). If one steadfastly cultivates with sincere devotion (执心精进), does not violate **scripture and teaching** (经教), expounds the **Dao/Way’s Law** (道法), prolongs life and augments destiny (益人寿算), and records the **virtuous and sinful deeds of mortals and spirits** (度录左契), they may be exempted from calamities (文免患难). Such individuals are known as **"Upper Three Heavens"** (上三天), **"Overcoming the Calamities"** (克名玉录), and are **elevated as True Persons** (拜为真人).

**The Eight Festival Days of the Daoist Assembly (八节日仙官会):**
  Their distinctions were previously mentioned.
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Spring** (立春日), the **True Person of the Supreme Ultimate** (太极真人) assembles all **Daoist True Persons** (诸仙真), carving **jade tablets** (刻玉简) and recording their names (记仙名).
  - On the **Day of the Spring Equinox** (春分日), the **True Person of Supreme Purity** (太素真人) assembles all **Daoist officials** (仙官), at the **Jade Terrace of Kunlun** (昆仑瑶台) to verify and rectify the **true scriptures** (真经).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Summer** (立夏日), the **Five Emperors** (五帝) convene with all **gods and Daoists** (神仙) at the **Purple Micro Palace** (紫微宫), where they meet the **Four True Persons** (见四真人) and judge the **merits and sins of those seeking the Dao** (论求道者之功罪).
  - On the **Day of the Summer Solstice** (夏至之日), the **Three Celestial Orders** (上三天官) gather at the **Lord of the Si He** (司何侯), to verify the **fate and fortune of ten thousand people** (校定万人罪福), extending years and reducing misfortunes (增年减算).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Autumn** (立秋之日), the **True Persons of the Five Sacred Peaks** (五岳真人) assemble to pay homage to the **Yellow Old Lord** (黄老君) at the **Yellow Chamber Cloud Court Mountain** (黄房云庭之山), gathering **Daoist officials** (仙官) to establish the **divine diagram and immortal elixirs** (定神图灵药).
  - On the **Day of the Autumn Equinox** (秋分之日), the **Uppermost Celestial Sovereign** (上皇太帝君) ascends to the **Supreme Purity** (上清), summoning **myriad True Persons and Daoists** (众真万仙) to convene at the **Lofty Yang Hall** (寥阳之殿). They collectively determine the **fate and fortune of ten thousand people** (议定天下万人罪福), record the **diligent or negligent pursuit of the Dao** (记学道求仙之懃懈), and clarify the **offenses against the day and moon** (疏犯过日月) and the **punishments for virtuous and sinful deeds** (修行善恶刑罚之科). The **roots and origins of rituals** (根源修例) are established, and the records are entrusted to the **Officer of Life** (副之司命), inscribed on the **Yellow Talisman** (书于黄箓).
  - On the **Day of the Beginning of Winter** (立冬之日), the **True Person of the Yang Terrace** (阳台真人) assembles all **Daoist immortals** (仙人), to verify and enroll those newly **enlightened to the Dao** (新得道), marking their entry into the **Daoist register** (始入名仙录).
  - On the **Day of the Winter Solstice** (冬至之日), all **Daoists** (仙) pay homage to the **Eastern Sea Green Boy Lord** (方诸东海青童君), to carve and define the **Daoist register** (刻定众仙籍). The **golden script** (金书) is inscribed with the **inner characters** (内字), aligned with the **stem and branch of the Geng-Shen day** (甲子日支干端数), and the **six decades** (六旬归宗) are harmonized with the **celestial and human records** (天人合纪). The **four seasons** (四时) are celebrated in joy (加庆).

  - On the **Day of the Geng-Shen Cycle** (庚申之日), **Golden Menace** (金威) brings stern punishment, the **Tai Fu Palace** (岱府) upholds the law, and the **soul and spirit** (魄精) are bound by transgressions. The **corpses and ghosts** (尸鬼) report evil deeds, and life originates from this source. Thus, one must **restrain the evil currents** (检遏邪津) and **manifest the true Dao** (开显正道).

**The Days of Celestial Movements (月建之日):**
  When the **yin and yang** (阴阳) shift their degrees, all **hundred spirits** (百神) receive their duties. The **new virtue** (建德惟新) begins, and all prior **condemnations** (先谴) are lifted. One may then **advance in virtuous cultivation** (进修后善).

**The Day of the New Moon (月晦之日):**
  The **yin essence is ruined** (阴精毁损), and the **lunar phases cycle** (躔次数周). The **Netherworld** (幽府) searches the records, and the **officials** (司官) establish the **laws** (定律).

**The Day of the Full Moon (月望之日):**
  The **full orb is complete** (圆魄充满), and the **sunlight harmonizes** (阳光合映), illuminating the **dark transgressions** (冥愆) and dispelling the **hidden sins** (幽咎). It scrutinizes the past and illuminates the future (察往照来), and its **mechanism** (机动) ensures **all is connected** (必接).

**The Day of the Geng-Shen Cycle (甲寅日):**
  It is also the **hour when souls and spirits grow restless** (魂魄躁竞之辰).

**The Ten Pure Months (十直之日):**
  All **celestial sovereigns and Daoist True Persons** (诸天上帝, 妙行真人) gather at the **Mysterious Capital Jade Palace** (玄都玉京), to pay homage to the **Emperor of the Great Dao** (虚皇大道君). They **verify and inspect the records of mortal and ghostly sins and merits** (简校人鬼生死罪录), distinguishing **virtue and vice** (善恶殊分).

**The Five Substances (五物):**
  Also called the **Five Phases** (五行):
  1. **Blood** (血) – **Heavenly Water** (天水),
  2. **Bone** (骨) – **Heavenly Wood** (天木),
  3. **Muscle/Flesh** (肉) – **Heavenly Earth** (天土),
  4. **Teeth** (齿) – **Heavenly Metal** (天金),
  5. **Breath** (气) – **Heavenly *Qi*** (天气).*」

  4. **Through Practicing as the Law Dictates** (因如法修行而得悟理).

chunks.original_text: 天火 五盟：谓五教，不笃结约而盟之。 七诅：谓违於仁义礼智信，引道天神地祇人鬼日月星血盟。 三寿：一上品百二十，二中品百岁，三下品八十岁。 三命：一曰罚命，行不善天所亡。 谓慢易天地，轻侮神灵，伐於山川，伤残贤良，天府所亡。 二曰疾命，邪欲多病所生。 谓饮食无量，房内无度，众邪所疾，天数不遂也。 三曰度命，众命之数，纪物之终。 谓人禀於神，神留於精，精尽老朽殂落。 六入：声入耳，色入眼，香入鼻，物入身，味入舌，事入心。 外来谓入。 六情：前已有不同。 一耳听宫商角征羽，二眼视青黄赤白黑，三鼻知躁燋香臭腥腐，四身知寒温刚柔滑，五舌知酸苦甘辛醎，六心知善恶喜怒哀乐。 外来曰尘，内动曰情。 六度：一能进勤，二能守雌，三能施终，四能忍辱，五能戒信，六能弃酒色。 八行：一能受非不自申，二能让德於人，三能不欲人之欲，四能容无理不诉，五能无远道身藏幽处，六能不自违心，七能不负经戒，八能不代口所诵。 四德：一志向定矣，二秉操坚矣，三勤心至矣，四守情笃矣。 五毒：一水漂溺之苦，二火焚灼之苦，三五贼五兵之苦，四病狂厉之苦，五害玃搏齿蹋触螫之毒。 九府：天官中府左府右府，地府#1中府左府右府，水官中府左府中府。 三宝：亦谓三尊，道宝，经宝，真人宝。 三奇：一《大洞真经》，二《雌一五老经》，三《太丹隐书经》。 仙府九宫：一曰太清，二太极，三太微，四紫房，五玄台，六帝堂，七天府，八皇宫，九玉京玄都。 神丹九品； 一曰太和自然龙胎之醴，二玉胎琼液之膏，三飞丹紫华流精，四珠光雪碧之腴，五九泉红华神丹，六太清金液之华，七九转霜雪之丹，八九鼎云英，九云光水石流霞。 上三天：太赤天，禹余天，清微天。 故治六天下上：第一赤虚天，第二泰玄都，第三皓天，第四泰玄天，第五太玄苍天，第六太清天。 元始九天：第一郁单无量天，去第二天二十四万里。 第二上上禅善无量寿天，去第三天四千六万里。 第三梵监须延天，去第四天六百七十二万里。 第四寂然兜术天，去第五天一千二百四十万里。 第五不骄乐天，去第六天三千六百八十万里。 第六化应声天，去第七天五千三百八十四万里。 第七梵宝天，去第八天五百二十万里。 第八梵摩迦夷天，去第九天六百八十万里。 第九波梨答和天，去下五百亿 二十万里。 玄都八方：东大堂乡，纳善世。 南宛利城，弃贤世。 西福堂州，□□□#2。 北郁单野，清净世。 东南无福田，用贤世。 西南延福乡，仁静世。 西北福德乡，延贤世。 东北福集乡，长安世。 昆仑九土：东信土阳州，南泼土迎州，西坼土拾州，北成土玄州，中面土冀州，东北咸土威州，东南农土神州，西南陷土成州，西北肥土柱州。 天地九元：上元之上，九九八十一万岁，上元之中，八八六十四万岁； 上元之下，七七四十九万岁。 中元之上，六六三十六万岁； 中元之中，五五二十五万岁； 中元之下，四四十六万岁。 下元之上，三三九万岁； 下元之中，二二四万岁； 下元之下，一一二万岁。 右三元合二百八十六万岁。 是时天尊在贾奕天上，七宝紫微宫中，与七千亿众讲论妙法。 时彼众中有一真人名海空智藏，长跪稽首，请问玄门众生，发心入道，阶级升降，三清十转名号。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Five Sacred Fires (天火) – Five Oaths (五盟):**
  These are the **Five Teachings** (五教), where those who do not sincerely uphold their bonds are bound by oath.

**The Seven Curses (七诅):**
  Those who violate **benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and trust** (仁义礼智信), invoking the **Dao/Way of Heavenly Gods, Earthly Spirits, Human Ghosts, Sun, Moon, Stars, and Blood Oaths** (道天神地祇人鬼日月星血盟).

**The Three Lifespans (三寿):**
  1. **Upper Grade (上品):** 120 years,
  2. **Middle Grade (中品):** 100 years,
  3. **Lower Grade (下品):** 80 years.

**The Three Fates (三命):**
  1. **Fated Punishment (罚命):** Lost by unvirtuous deeds (行不善天所亡).
     Those who **defy Heaven and Earth, scorn the sacred, ravage mountains and rivers, or harm the virtuous** (慢易天地，轻侮神灵，伐於山川，伤残贤良) are doomed by the **Celestial Storehouse** (天府所亡).
  2. **Fated Sickness (疾命):** Illness born of licentious desires (邪欲多病所生).
     Those who **indulge excessively in food and drink, or lack restraint in private matters** (饮食无量，房内无度) are struck by **malevolent forces** (众邪所疾), thwarting Heaven’s decree (天数不遂).
  3. **Fated Termination (度命):** The natural end of all fated lives (众命之数，纪物之终).
     **Mortals draw essence from the Divine** (人禀於神), **the Divine lingers in the vital essence** (神留於精), and when the essence is spent, **aging and death follow** (精尽老朽殂落).

**The Six Entrances (六入):**
  **Sounds enter the ears**, **colors the eyes**, **fragrances the nose**, **objects the body**, **flavors the tongue**, **matters the heart**.
  *(External stimuli are called "入".)*

**The Six Senses (六情):**
  *(As previously distinguished.)*
  1. **Ears** discern the **Five Tones** (宫商角征羽),
  2. **Eyes** perceive the **Five Colors** (青黄赤白黑),
  3. **Nose** detects **aromas and foul odors** (躁燋香臭腥腐),
  4. **Body** senses **temperature and texture** (寒温刚柔滑),
  5. **Tongue** tastes the **Five Flavors** (酸苦甘辛醎),
  6. **Heart** discerns **virtue, vice, joy, anger, sorrow, and delight** (善恶喜怒哀乐).
  *(External stimuli are called "dust" (尘), internal responses "emotions" (情).)*

**The Six Virtues (六度):**
  1. **Diligence in advancement** (能进勤),
  2. **Humility in retreat** (能守雌),
  3. **Completing what is begun** (能施终),
  4. **Enduring insults** (能忍辱),
  5. **Upholding trust** (能戒信),
  6. **Abandoning wine and lust** (能弃酒色).

**The Eight Practices (八行):**
  1. **Accepting blame without self-justification** (能受非不自申),
  2. **Yielding virtue to others** (能让德於人),
  3. **Refraining from coveting others’ desires** (能不欲人之欲),
  4. **Tolerating injustice without complaint** (能容无理不诉),
  5. **Avoiding distant travels, hiding in seclusion** (能无远道身藏幽处),
  6. **Never betraying one’s true heart** (能不自违心),
  7. **Never violating scriptural precepts** (能不负经戒),
  8. **Never reciting scriptures for personal gain** (能不代口所诵).

**The Four Virtues (四德):**
  1. **Resolute intent** (志向定矣),
  2. **Unshakable principle** (秉操坚矣),
  3. **Unflagging devotion** (勤心至矣),
  4. **Steadfast restraint** (守情笃矣).

**The Five Torments (五毒):**
  1. **Drowning in water** (水漂溺之苦),
  2. **Burning in fire** (火焚灼之苦),
  3. **Assault by bandits and weapons** (五贼五兵之苦),
  4. **Madness and violent illness** (病狂厉之苦),
  5. **Harm from venomous creatures** (害玃搏齿蹋触螫之毒).

**The Nine Palaces (九府):**
  **Celestial Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (天官中府左府右府),
  **Earthly Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (地府#1中府左府右府),
  **Water Palace:** Central, Left, Right Palaces (水官中府左府中府).

**The Three Treasures (三宝):**
  Also called the **Three Revered Ones** (三尊):
  **Dao/Way Treasure** (道宝), **Scripture Treasure** (经宝), **True Person Treasure** (真人宝).

**The Three Sacred Scriptures (三奇):**
  1. *The Great Cavern True Scripture* (《大洞真经》),
  2. *The Feminine Unity Five Elders Scripture* (《雌一五老经》),
  3. *The Hidden Elixir of the Great Dan Scripture* (《太丹隐书经》).

**The Nine Celestial Palaces (仙府九宫):**
  1. **Great Clarity** (太清),
  2. **Great Polarity** (太极),
  3. **Great Obscurity** (太微),
  4. **Purple Chamber** (紫房),
  5. **Mysterious Platform** (玄台),
  6. **Imperial Hall** (帝堂),
  7. **Heavenly Storehouse** (天府),
  8. **Royal Palace** (皇宫),
  9. **Jade Capital Mysterious Metropolis** (玉京玄都).

**The Nine Grades of Divine Elixirs (神丹九品):**
  1. **Supreme Harmony Natural Dragon Womb Nectar** (太和自然龙胎之醴),
  2. **Jade Womb Essence Ointment** (玉胎琼液之膏),
  3. **Flying Elixir Purple Flower Refined Essence** (飞丹紫华流精),
  4. **Pearl-Light Snowy Jade Nourishment** (珠光雪碧之腴),
  5. **Nine Springs Red Flower Divine Elixir** (九泉红华神丹),
  6. **Supreme Clarity Golden Elixir** (太清金液之华),
  7. **Nine Refined Frost-Snow Elixir** (九转霜雪之丹),
  8. **Nine Cauldrons Cloud Essence** (九鼎云英),
  9. **Cloud-Light Water-Stone Flowing Constellation** (云光水石流霞).

**The Three Upper Heavens (上三天):**
  **Great Vermilion Heaven** (太赤天), **Yu’s Remnant Heaven** (禹余天), **Pure Luminosity Heaven** (清微天).

**The Six Celestial Realms Below (故治六天下上):**
  1. **Vermilion Void Heaven** (第一赤虚天),
  2. **Great Mysterious Capital** (第二泰玄都),
  3. **Luminous Heaven** (第三皓天),
  4. **Great Mysterious Heaven** (第四泰玄天),
  5. **Supreme Mysterious Azure Heaven** (第五太玄苍天),
  6. **Supreme Clarity Heaven** (第六太清天).

**The Nine Heavens of Primordial Beginning (元始九天):**
  1. **Idyllic Boundless Heaven** (郁单无量天), **24 million li** from the second.
  2. **Uppermost Upper Tranquil Blessed Boundless Lifespan Heaven** (上上禅善无量寿天), **4,600 million li** from the third.
  3. **Brahman’s Supervisory Extended Heaven** (梵监须延天), **672 million li** from the fourth.
  4. **Silent Encompassing Tu-Su Heaven** (寂然兜术天), **1,240 million li** from the fifth.
  5. **Unarrogant Joyful Heaven** (不骄乐天), **3,680 million li** from the sixth.
  6. **Responsive Sound Heaven** (化应声天), **5,384 million li** from the seventh.
  7. **Brahman’s Treasure Heaven** (梵宝天), **520 million li** from the eighth.
  8. **Brahman’s Maha-Kala Heaven** (梵摩迦夷天), **680 million li** from the ninth.
  9. **Bodhi’s Answering Heaven** (波梨答和天), **500 billion, 20 million li** below.

**The Eight Directions of the Mysterious Metropolis (玄都八方):**
  **East – Great Hall District:** Receives the Virtuous (纳善世).
  **South – Wanli City:** Abandons the Wise (弃贤世).
  **West – Blessing Hall Prefecture:** [Text missing] (□□□#2).
  **North – Idyllic Wilderness:** Pure World (清净世).
  **Southeast – No-Blessing Fields:** Uses the Wise (用贤世).
  **Southwest – Extended Blessing District:** Tranquil Benevolence (仁静世).
  **Northwest – Blessing Virtue District:** Extends the Wise (延贤世).
  **Northeast – Blessing Gathering District:** Long Peace (长安世).

**The Nine Soils of Kunlun (昆仑九土):**
  **East – Faith Soil, Yang Prefecture** (信土阳州),
  **South – Scattered Soil, Welcoming Prefecture** (泼土迎州),
  **West – Cleaved Soil, Gathering Prefecture** (坼土拾州),
  **North – Complete Soil, Mysterious Prefecture** (成土玄州),
  **Central – Facing Soil, Ji Prefecture** (中面土冀州),
  **Northeast – Salty Soil,威 Prefecture** (咸土威州),
  **Southeast – Agricultural Soil, Divine Prefecture** (农土神州),
  **Southwest – Sunken Soil, Achievement Prefecture** (陷土成州),
  **Northwest – Fertile Soil, Pillar Prefecture** (肥土柱州).

**The Nine Primordial Cycles of Heaven and Earth (天地九元):**
  **Upper Primordial (上元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 81 million years (九九八十一万岁),
    - **Middle:** 64 million years (八八六十四万岁),
    - **Lower:** 49 million years (七七四十九万岁).
  **Middle Primordial (中元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 36 million years (六六三十六万岁),
    - **Middle:** 25 million years (五五二十五万岁),
    - **Lower:** 16 million years (四四十六万岁).
  **Lower Primordial (下元):**
    - **Uppermost:** 9 million years (三三九万岁),
    - **Middle:** 4 million years (二二四万岁),
    - **Lower:** 2 million years (一一二万岁).
  **Total:** 286 million years (右三元合二百八十六万岁).

**At this time, the Celestial Sovereign resides in the Jade-Yu Heavenly Palace (贾奕天上, 七宝紫微宫中), teaching the **Mysterious Law** (妙法) to **700 billion beings** (七千亿众). Among them, a **True Person named Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard** (海空智藏) knelt in homage and inquired:
*"How do mortals who aspire to the Dao/Way attain enlightenment? What are the ranks and transformations—from the Three Pure Ones to the Ten Transmutations—and their respective titles?"* (玄门众生，发心入道，阶级升降，三清十转名号).

**The Five Substances (五物):**
  Also called the **Five Phases** (五行):
  1. **Blood** (血) – **Heavenly Water** (天水),
  2. **Bone** (骨) – **Heavenly Wood** (天木),
  3. **Muscle/Flesh** (肉) – **Heavenly Earth** (天土),

chunks.original_text: 尔时天尊告海空智藏：汝等当知，十方大圣，初进道三阶十转，次第阶梯。 汝今审听十转，以前三阶进趣。 何等为三阶？ 以前不同，一者信阶，二者行阶，三者回向阶。 信膈之中，有十心。 何等为十？ 一者信心，二进心，三念心，四慧心，五定心，六戒心，七回向心，八护法心，九舍法心，十愿心。 行阶之中有十行，信、进、念、慧、定、戒、回向、护法、舍法、愿心等是十行。 回向阶中有十回向：信心，进心，念心，慧心，定心，戒心，回向心，护法心，舍法心，愿心等是十回向，三阶发心。 进趣入道方便，依凭胜心，进入十转，与已前十转全别。 一者证实转，二离障转，三光明对治转，四智火烧然转，五权魔胜转，六现前显德转，七远行光惠转，八相无相不动转，九定慧相应转，十法地究竟转。 海空智藏，此中十转，乃是过去未来见在三世天尊，异时同说，为叹对治。 道心真人十种障：一者对治众生障，二对治众生邪行障，三於闻思修习受忍不通障，四自六解发心起高慢障，五自知诸法我慢众人障，六除十转己前烦恼习障，七除细法智障，八断无明有障，九断不善利佗障，十者於法示得自在障。 海空智藏真人，为欲断除入道真人十种障故，现行灭尽，令种不生，故立十转。 何故？ 物名证实乃至地究竟转者，为欲利益，智汝渐明，进入物转。 十转义者：第一为证见道性真实妙理，故名证实转。 第二为得净妙戒，具足清净，妙戒具足清净，离烦恼吝障，故名离障转。 第三为随闻无漏善法，思量修习，照明显现，故名光明对治转。 第四为烦恼成薪，智火烧烬，故名智火烧然转。 第五为得出世间无漏圣智，善行方便，离诸烦恼，舍有漏心，降伏众魔，故名摧魔胜转。 第六为入深智慧到於彼岸，自佗俱利，智德现前，故名现前显德转。 第七为修无相法，功力究竟，譬如人行去我渐远，故名远行光慧转。 第八为果德纯熟，於无相行中无间阙，故名不动转。 第九为无碍慧心，向众生说法成就中利佗，故名定慧相应转。 第十为得法身具足，众德圆满，毕竟自在，故名法地究竟转。 以是大士受法王位，犹如太子於诸王中而得自在。 仍此位十转，仍有微细障，犹未解脱。 对治此微，细习障故，未得证入天尊地。 於此地中，事已究竟，具足众德，圆备道性，智性平等无二，五大三德，十法具足，成就三身法报应等，愿行利益，众德圆备。 十法具足：何等为十？ 一者辞无明父母，二别生死眷属，三入重玄门，四历事十方天尊，五与其伴类相识，六同坐解脱床，七究竟常乐，八摄受门徒，九授布三乘教法，十三德圆备。 何者为三德？ 一者证道智德，二烦恼德，三悲多恩德。 财用自在，三身备具，法身，报身，应身。 道门经法相承次序卷下竟 #1地府：当作『地官』 。 #2此处脱漏三字。

At that time, the Celestial Sovereign instructed **Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard** (海空智藏):

*"You must understand that the **Great Saints of the Ten Directions** (十方大圣) enter the Dao/Way through three progressive stages of ten transformations each, ascending in order. You must now carefully listen to the ten transformations, for they differ entirely from the three preceding stages.

What are these three stages? First, the **Stage of Faith** (信阶); second, the **Stage of Practice** (行阶); third, the **Stage of Dedication** (回向阶).

Within the **Stage of Faith** (信膈), there are ten states of mind. What are these ten? First, the **Mind of Faith** (信心); second, the **Mind of Advancement** (进心); third, the **Mind of Reflection** (念心); fourth, the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧心); fifth, the **Mind of Concentration** (定心); sixth, the **Mind of Precepts** (戒心); seventh, the **Mind of Dedication** (回向心); eighth, the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法心); ninth, the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法心); tenth, the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心).

Within the **Stage of Practice** (行阶), there are ten practices: the **Mind of Faith** (信), the **Mind of Advancement** (进), the **Mind of Reflection** (念), the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧), the **Mind of Concentration** (定), the **Mind of Precepts** (戒), the **Mind of Dedication** (回向), the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法), the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法), and the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心)—these are the ten practices.

Within the **Stage of Dedication** (回向阶), there are ten dedicatory practices: the **Mind of Faith** (信心), the **Mind of Advancement** (进心), the **Mind of Reflection** (念心), the **Mind of Wisdom** (慧心), the **Mind of Concentration** (定心), the **Mind of Precepts** (戒心), the **Mind of Dedication** (回向心), the **Mind of Dharma Protection** (护法心), the **Mind of Renunciation** (舍法心), and the **Mind of Aspiration** (愿心)—these are the ten dedicatory practices, comprising the three stages of aspiration.

The **method of entering the Dao/Way** (入道方便) relies on **victorious aspiration** (胜心) to proceed into the ten transformations, which are entirely distinct from the previous ten.

What are these ten? First, the **Transformation of True Realization** (证实转); second, the **Transformation of Removing Obstacles** (离障转); third, the **Transformation of Radiant Clarity and Counteraction** (光明对治转); fourth, the **Transformation of Wisdom-Fire Consuming** (智火烧然转); fifth, the **Transformation of Subduing Demons** (权魔胜转); sixth, the **Transformation of Manifesting Virtues** (现前显德转); seventh, the **Transformation of Illuminating the Distant Path** (远行光惠转); eighth, the **Transformation of Unchanging Non-Duality** (相无相不动转); ninth, the **Transformation of Concentration and Wisdom in Harmony** (定慧相应转); tenth, the **Transformation of Ultimate Dharma Realm** (法地究竟转).

**Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard**, these ten transformations are the same as those taught by the Celestial Sovereign in the **past, future, and present three worlds** (过去未来见在三世), though spoken at different times, to be praised and countered.

The **True Person** (道心真人) faces ten kinds of obstacles in their aspiration to the Dao/Way. What are these ten? First, the obstacle of **countering the defilements of beings** (对治众生障); second, the obstacle of **countering the evil deeds of beings** (对治众生邪行障); third, the obstacle of **not understanding or enduring the teachings upon hearing or reflection** (於闻思修习受忍不通障); fourth, the obstacle of **arrogance arising from self-liberation** (自六解发心起高慢障); fifth, the obstacle of **egoistic attachment to the nature of dharmas** (我慢众人障); sixth, the obstacle of **habitual defilements from prior transformations** (除十转己前烦恼习障); seventh, the obstacle of **subtle defilements of wisdom** (除细法智障); eighth, the obstacle of **remaining deluded despite severing ignorance** (断无明有障); ninth, the obstacle of **not abandoning unwholesome deeds** (断不善利佗障); tenth, the obstacle of **not attaining freedom in the Dharma** (於法示得自在障).

**Sea-Empty Wisdom-Hoard True Person**, to sever these ten obstacles of entering the Dao/Way, practices and extinguishes them utterly, so that they do not arise again. Thus, the ten transformations are established.

Why? The reason for naming these transformations from **True Realization** (证实) to **Ultimate Dharma Realm** (地究竟) is to benefit beings, gradually enlightening their wisdom and leading them into the transformations of the Dao/Way.

The meaning of the ten transformations is as follows:

The **First Transformation of True Realization** (证实转) is to **attain insight into the true and wondrous nature of the Dao/Way** (证见道性真实妙理).

The **Second Transformation of Removing Obstacles** (离障转) is to **obtain pure and wondrous precepts**, fully endowed with purity, **removing defilements and avarice**, hence the name.

The **Third Transformation of Radiant Clarity and Counteraction** (光明对治转) is to **reflect upon and practice flawless teachings**, **illuminating and manifesting** them clearly.

The **Fourth Transformation of Wisdom-Fire Consuming** (智火烧然转) is to **burn defilements to ashes with the fire of wisdom** (烦恼成薪，智火烧烬).

The **Fifth Transformation of Subduing Demons** (摧魔胜转) is to **acquire transcendent, flawless wisdom**, **virtuous means**, and **freedom from all defilements**, **abandoning the defiled mind**, and **subduing all demons** (降伏众魔).

The **Sixth Transformation of Manifesting Virtues** (现前显德转) is to **enter profound wisdom**, **reach the other shore**, and **benefit all beings** (自佗俱利), **manifesting the virtues of wisdom** (智德现前).

The **Seventh Transformation of Illuminating the Distant Path** (远行光慧转) is to **practice the Dharma of non-duality**, **culminating in its power**, **like a traveler gradually moving away from home** (去我渐远).

The **Eighth Transformation of Unchanging Non-Duality** (不动转) is to **refine the fruits of virtue**, **remaining undisturbed in the practice of non-duality** (於无相行中无间阙).

The **Ninth Transformation of Concentration and Wisdom in Harmony** (定慧相应转) is to **attain unobstructed wisdom**, **benefiting all beings in teaching the Dharma** (向众生说法成就中利佗).

The **Tenth Transformation of Ultimate Dharma Realm** (法地究竟转) is to **obtain the Dharma Body**, **perfect in all virtues**, and **ultimately free** (毕竟自在).

Thus, the **Great Bodhisattva** (大士) receives the **position of the Dharma King** (法王位), akin to a **prince attaining sovereignty among all kings** (太子於诸王中而得自在).

Even in this position of the ten transformations, **subtle obstacles remain**, as **liberation has not yet been fully attained**. To counter these **subtle, habitual obstacles** (微细障), one must not yet have **entered the Celestial Sovereign’s realm** (证入天尊地).

In this stage, **all practices are consummated**, **all virtues are perfected**, **the Dao/Way’s nature is fully realized**, and **wisdom and virtue are equal and undivided**. The **Five Aggregates and Three Powers** (五大三德) are complete, and the **ten virtues of the Dharma** (十法) are fully attained, **culminating in the Three Bodies and the Dharma Response** (三身法报应等), with **aspirations and virtues perfected**.

What are these **ten virtues of the Dharma** (十法具足)? First, **severing the parents of ignorance** (辞无明父母); second, **parting from the relatives of birth and death** (别生死眷属); third, **entering the profound Dao/Way** (入重玄门); fourth, **attending the Celestial Sovereign in the Ten Directions** (历事十方天尊); fifth, **recognizing their companions** (与其伴类相识); sixth, **sitting together on the bed of liberation** (同坐解脱床); seventh, **attaining ultimate and constant bliss** (究竟常乐); eighth, **gathering and receiving disciples** (摄受门徒); ninth, **granting the Three Vehicles of teaching** (授布三乘教法); tenth, **perfecting thirteen virtues** (十三德圆备).

What are these **three virtues** (三德)? First, the **virtue of realizing the Dao/Way** (证道智德); second, the **virtue of defilements** (烦恼德); third, the **virtue of compassion and boundless kindness** (悲多恩德).

With **wealth in sovereign freedom**, the **Three Bodies are fully realized**: the **Dharma Body** (法身), the **Reward Body** (报身), and the **Response Body** (应身).

The **scriptures of the Dao/Way’s gate** (道门经法) are transmitted in this sequence. *End of Volume #1.*
